0.title: BJP-JJP coalition govt believes in event management: Ex-Haryana CM
0.article_body: Former Haryana CM and Leader of Opposition Bhupinder Singh Hooda said the BJP-JJP coalition government believes in "event management". He claimed Haryana was a "knowledge hub" when Congress was in power, however, now state universities are falling out of the top 100. "This is because...a non-performing government, which only believes in event management, is running the state," he added.

1.title: Ravi Shastri had 'very low' tolerance for failure: Dinesh Karthik
1.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said ex-Team India head coach Ravi Shastri had "very low" tolerance for failure. "He had a very low tolerance for somebody who would bat at a certain pace he did not like or someone who was doing very differently in the nets and in the match, he would go and bat differently," added Karthik.

2.title: He should've just pulled his hair: NBA star Hart on Nunez's headbutt
2.article_body: NBA player Josh Hart has tweeted that Liverpool's Darwin Nunez would have escaped without punishment, if he had "pulled" Crystal Palace defender Joachim Andersen's hair, rather than headbutting him. Hart was referring to Tottenham Hotspur's Cristian Romero getting away without a booking for pulling Chelsea defender Marc Cucurella's hair during a match. Nunez was sent off following his headbutt.

3.title: Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts from August 17-19
3.article_body: Several areas in Bengaluru will face power cuts from August 17-19 between 10 am and 6 pm due to repair and maintenance work undertaken by the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM). The areas that will be affected today include Alagatta, Kenchamma Naguhalli, Hosur, etc. Whereas, areas that will be affected on August 18 include Hanumanthapura, Marenahalli, Rangapura, etc.

4.title: Vijay Deverakonda arrives at 'Liger' event in auto-rickshaw, video surfaces
4.article_body: A video of actor Vijay Deverakonda arriving at the sets of a dance reality show in Mumbai for promoting his upcoming film 'Liger' in an auto-rickshaw has surfaced on social media. In the video, Vijay can be seen wearing a white outfit. Reacting to the video, a fan commented, "Real hero with no attitude...very humble."

5.title: Chocolates worth ₹17 lakh stolen from Cadbury godown in UP: Report
5.article_body: About 150 cartons of Cadbury chocolate bars worth ₹17 lakh were reportedly stolen from a godown in Chinhat area of Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. The incident occurred on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday, the reports added. The godown was earlier the home of Cadbury distributor Rajendra Singh Sidhu, who recently shifted to an apartment in Gomti Nagar.

6.title: Jacqueline named as accused in ED chargesheet in ₹200 crore extortion case: Report
6.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez has been named as an accused in the Enforcement Directorate's supplementary chargesheet filed in the ₹200 crore extortion case against conman Sukesh Chandrashekar, reports said on Wednesday. Reports said that she was aware of the extortion taking place. The ED had earlier attached ₹7.27 crore funds of Fernandez under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

7.title: Over 150 children dead in Zimbabwe measles outbreak
7.article_body: A measles outbreak in Zimbabwe has killed at least 157 children, with the death toll nearly doubling in less than a week, the government said. The total number of suspected measles cases nationwide has risen from 1,036 to 2,056 in just four days, Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa said. Earlier, the government had blamed gatherings of religious sects for the outbreak.

8.title: 21-yr-old student from Puducherry dies of suspected drug overdose in Goa
8.article_body: A 21-year-old college student from Puducherry died of a suspected drug overdose at Goa Medical College and Hospital, a police spokesperson said. He was admitted to the hospital in serious condition on Tuesday, the spokesperson added. The youth had arrived in Goa along with his three friends on Saturday. However, his friends claimed he had not consumed any narcotics substances.

9.title: Anupam shares pics from David Dhawan's b'day party, says 'We're the best'
9.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram and shared pictures from filmmaker David Dhawan's birthday party. He posted pictures with David, Satish Kaushik, Shakti Kapoor, Chunky Panday and Rajpal Yadav. Along with the pictures, he wrote, "With birthday boy David Dhawan and my dearest friends who I have spent some memorable times with!! We are the best."

10.title: Apple suppliers to produce Apple Watch, MacBook in Vietnam: Report
10.article_body: Apple's suppliers are mulling over producing Apple Watch and MacBook in Vietnam for the first time, Nikkei Asia reported. According to reports, Apple suppliers Foxconn and Luxshare Precision Industry have started test production of Apple Watch and MacBook in Northern Vietnam. Apple has been shifting some areas of iPhone production from China to other markets, including India.

11.title: Woman dragged on road in snatching incident in Delhi; act caught on CCTV
11.article_body: A 46-year-old woman was dragged on the road when two bike-borne men pulled her bag in Delhi's Greater Kailash market. The incident, which took place on July 30, was caught on CCTV in which the woman can be seen falling down and being dragged. The victim was heading towards her guest house after having dinner when the incident happened.

12.title: Water level of Yamuna crosses warning level in Delhi
12.article_body: Water level of Yamuna river in Delhi crossed the warning mark of 204.5 metres today. The surge in water level happened after Haryana released more water from Hathnikund Barrage amid rains in the upper catchment areas, officials said. This is the second time water level crossed danger mark in August. Earlier on August 12, the river crossed 205.33 metres mark.

13.title: Sexual harassment complaint won't prima facie stand if woman wore provocative dress: Court
13.article_body: While granting anticipatory bail to social activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case, a Kerala Court observed that the offence under Section 354A of the Indian Penal Code is not prima facie attracted if the woman is wearing "sexually provocative dresses". The court expressed disbelief that the physically disabled accused could forcefully put the complainant in his lap.

14.title: Oil prices recover from 6-month low as US crude oil stockpiles drop
14.article_body: With a drop in US oil and gasoline stockpiles, oil prices recovered from a six-month low and increased on Wednesday even as investors are assured of a resilient demand. Brent futures rose to $92.47 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate futures increased to $86.80 a barrel. Crude stocks fell by 4,48,000 barrels for the week ended August 12, sources said.

15.title: Your healthy lifestyle starts with picking the right cooking oil: Oleev
15.article_body: Oleev Active with the goodness of olive oil is specially created to fulfil the demands of the modern lifestyle, said the brand. It has an Energocules formula that will ensure you stay active and energized throughout the day, it revealed, adding that after all, you are what you eat.

16.title: 'New TMC in 6 months' posters with Abhishek Banerjee's photos put up in Kolkata
16.article_body: Posters claiming that "new and reformed TMC will come into being in six months", with photographs of TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee have been put up in various parts of Kolkata. The posters didn't have West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee’s photo. "Maybe some over-enthusiastic party workers put up posters with his quotes issued in past," TMC's Kunal Ghosh said.

17.title: She questions you which is 'very irritating': Kashyap on Taapsee Pannu
17.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, whose upcoming film 'Dobaaraa' stars actress Taapsee Pannu, said she "pushes" him a lot. "She questions you which irritates you a lot. Taapsee keeps needling till she gets an answer," added Kashyap. Kashyap jokingly stated that Taapsee was soft-spoken when they first met, adding that she barged into his room and yelled the next time they met.

18.title: Cricket would lose something fundamental if we watch T20s only: Hussain
18.article_body: Talking about the emergence of multiple T20 franchise leagues in the world, former England captain Nasser Hussain said, "Cricket would be losing something fundamental if the only format we watch is T20 franchise stuff." Hussain added, "One area of concern is the extent to which white-ball cricket is now getting hold of players at the start of their careers."

19.title: Sensex crosses 60,000 mark for 1st time in over 4 months
19.article_body: BSE Sensex on Wednesday crossed the 60,000 mark for the first time during intraday trade since April 5. Meanwhile, NSE Nifty is currently trading at 17,923. Notably, the benchmark indices had opened on a higher note amid positive global trends. On Sensex, NTPC, Hindustan Unilever, Bajaj Finance, Asian Paints, UltraTech Cement and Reliance Industries were among the gainers.

20.title: Was paid much less in 'Jurassic...' than the reports said: Bryce Dallas
20.article_body: Actress Bryce Dallas Howard revealed that she was paid "so much less" for the 'Jurassic World' franchise than the reports suggested. "When I started negotiating for [Jurassic World], it was 2014...it was a different world and I was at a great disadvantage," she said. She added, "Unfortunately, you have to sign up for three movies...so your deals are set."

21.title: Largest aircraft Airbus A380 to land in B'luru for 1st time in October
21.article_body: The Airbus A380, which is the world's largest aircraft, will be deployed on the Bengaluru-Dubai route for the first time starting October 30. Emirates airline will be operating the double-decker aircraft service to and from Bengaluru. The aircraft will have three-class configurations apart from premium cabins, offering seats in Economy Class, Business Class and First Class.

22.title: Work on 4 Metro stations in Pune to be completed by August 31
22.article_body: The Maha Metro has sped up work on four stations in Pune, including Deccan Gymkhana, Chhatrapati Sambhaji Udyan, Pune Municipal Corporation and Civil Court, and is expected to finish it by August 31. According to an official, work on all four stations is 80% complete. "We're committed to open...remaining sections...in the coming months," said Maha Metro's Managing Director Brijesh Dixit.

23.title: Shinde-led Maharashtra govt announces 3% rise in DA for 17 lakh employees
23.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government on Tuesday announced a 3% rise in the dearness allowance (DA) payable to nearly 17 lakh government employees in the state. "This increase will be paid in cash from August 2022. Due to today's cabinet decision, the dearness allowance of state government employees will be increased from 31% to 34%," Shinde said on Tuesday.

24.title: 'Please leave me alone', says Bilkis Bano as 11 convicts in gangrape case walk free
24.article_body: A day after 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano and killing seven members of her family walked free in Gujarat, she said, "Please leave me alone...I've offered 'duas' for the soul of my daughter Saleha." Her husband Yakub Rasool said Bilkis couldn't believe they walked free, adding, she first broke into tears and then went silent.

25.title: Boult's IPL contract is ₹8 cr, he'll make more money in T20 leagues : Ashwin
25.article_body: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said pacer Trent Boult, who recently gave up his central contract, will make more money by playing in the T20 leagues than what he'll make by playing for New Zealand. "For that professional and financial liberation, he's not signing the central contract," added Ashwin. Boult was bought by RR for ₹8 crore in IPL auction.

26.title: Kenya's opposition leader to challenge presidential poll result after losing
26.article_body: After Kenya's Deputy President William Ruto won the presidential election, opposition leader Raila Odinga said that he would pursue all legal options to challenge the outcome. As per the official tally, Ruto narrowly beat his rival Odinga with 50.5% votes. Odinga called the figures declared by the election commission as "null and void", and his supporters alleged rampant electoral malpractice.

27.title: Musk says he was joking about buying Manchester Utd, tweets 'Not buying any sports teams'
27.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user, the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk clarified that he is not buying football club Manchester United. He wrote, "This is a long-running joke on Twitter. I'm not buying any sports teams." Earlier on Wednesday, Musk while commenting on a thread of political allegiances, tweeted, "I'm buying Manchester United ur welcome."

28.title: It's common; be it anything, trolling is always there: Vijay Deverakonda
28.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda opened up about social media trolling and said that it's an everyday thing. "It's common...Even before I became an actor, aunties...uncles used to troll about results, college, job, etc. and now it's social media trolling," he added. Vijay stated, "Be it anything, trolling is always there." Vijay will next be seen in 'Liger', which also features Ananya Panday.

29.title: Activist who opposed MP's Khargone bulldozer drive arrested under NSA
29.article_body: Muslim activist Zaid Pathan, who opposed the Madhya Pradesh government's Khargone bulldozer drive, has been arrested under the National Security Act (NSA). Pathan was arrested for allegedly disturbing communal harmony and posting objectionable posts on social media, Indore DM Manish Singh said. Khargone bulldozer drive had taken place following violence during Ram Navami processions.

30.title: T'gana Minister reviews arrangements for Ganesh festival in Hyderabad
30.article_body: Telangana Animal Husbandry Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav on Tuesday reviewed arrangements for Ganesh festival in Hyderabad. During the meeting, Talasani asked officials to repair damaged roads related to the routes of Ganesh procession within stipulated period. Further, state Home Minister Mahmood Ali directed police officials to deploy additional forces and 'SHE Teams' in suspected areas.

31.title: Senior UN official visits Myanmar to meet military leadership
31.article_body: A senior United Nations official, Noeleen Heyzer, arrived in the capital of Myanmar, Naypyidaw, on Tuesday to meet the country's military chief Min Aung Hlaing. "She will focus on addressing the deteriorating situation and immediate concerns," UN said in a statement. A junta spokesperson said that Heyzer has not requested to meet former Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi.

32.title: Sri Lanka says it's not paying for ex-Prez Rajapaksa's expenses abroad
32.article_body: The Sri Lankan government said that it's not paying for the overseas stay of ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who fled the country after mass protests. "All such expenses are borne by the personal funds of the former President," the Information Department said. Rajapaksa is currently in Thailand. He arrived in Thailand last week from Singapore after his short-term visit pass expired.

33.title: CNG price reduced by ₹4 per kg in Pune
33.article_body: Price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) has been reduced by ₹4 per kg in Pune starting today, the All India Petrol Dealers Association said. The CNG will now cost ₹87 per kg which was earlier priced at ₹91 per kg. The price reduction is done on account of a downward revision in the purchase cost of domestic natural gas.

34.title: Ten Hag would've got rid of every Man Utd player if he could: Ferdinand
34.article_body: With Manchester United winless in Premier League after 1-2 and 0-4 defeats against Brighton and Brentford respectively, ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said the club's manager Erik ten Hag would've "got rid" of every player if possible. "That's the dream scenario," he added. "When you don't have the balls to play, you don't deserve to get the shirt," stated Ferdinand.

35.title: Ghulam Nabi Azad quits J&K Congress post hours after appointment
35.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad resigned from the post of chairman of the Jammu and Kashmir campaign committee, hours after the appointment. He has also resigned from the party's Jammu and Kashmir political affairs committee. Azad cited health reasons while resigning, as per reports. Notably, the Congress campaign committee was newly constituted on Tuesday.

36.title: BMC blames illegal alterations for ceiling collapse in Mumbai's Mulund
36.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has blamed illegal alterations by the contractor for the collapse of ceiling in a residential building in Mumbai's Mulund East on Monday, which killed two senior citizens. The building was neither dilapidated nor dangerous but it was an old structure which was only up to ground floor for over 25 years, a senior official said.

37.title: Soaps can increase pimples, switch to Himalaya Neem Face Wash: Himalaya
37.article_body: Consumers use soap on their face, unaware that it can damage skin and increase pimples, revealed Himalaya. With its campaign, Himalaya aims to empower consumers with scientific knowledge to make right decisions. It urges consumers to trust science and switch to Himalaya Purifying Neem Face Wash claiming that it is 100% soap-free and clinically proven to prevent pimples from recurring.

38.title: Chat with soldier gave me power to do another film after Panipat: Arjun
38.article_body: Arjun Kapoor revealed he was unsure if he would be able to do 'Bhoot Police' after 'Panipat' failed and the theatres were shut due to lockdown. He added he met an army person when he reached Dalhousie for filming 'Bhoot Police'. "I was...broken...underconfident...I talked to him for three minutes...his words gave me the power to do that film," Arjun added.

39.title: All the Khans in B'wood are legends: Ektaa on boycott 'Laal...' trend
39.article_body: Producer Ektaa Kapoor has reacted to the Twitter trend calling for a boycott of Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "All the Khans in the industry (Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan)...especially Aamir, are legends. We cannot boycott them," she said. Ektaa added, "It is so strange we are boycotting the very people who've given the best of business in the industry."

40.title: Social imbalance, people with criminal antecedents: Sushil Modi on Bihar Cabinet
40.article_body: Following Bihar Cabinet expansion, Ex-Bihar Deputy CM and BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Tuesday said the new Cabinet reflects social imbalance and it has faces with criminal antecedents. "Surendra Yadav, Ramanand Yadav and Lalit Yadav, who are these people…What message [does] Nitishji wants to give by including such people in the Cabinet?" Sushil Kumar Modi asked.

41.title: Sania Mirza's sister Anam, Mohammed Asaduddin blessed with a baby girl, name her 'Dua'
41.article_body: Tennis player Sania Mirza's sister Anam and ex-Team India captain Mohammed Azharuddin's son Asaduddin have been blessed with a baby girl. Sharing the news on Instagram, Anam revealed that they have named their first child 'Dua' and wrote, "She’s doing well and so am I. Please keep Our Dua in your duas." Anam and Asaduddin got married in December 2019.

42.title: India reports 9,062 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in 24 hours
42.article_body: India has reported 9,062 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active cases in the country went down to 1,05,058, while the daily positivity rate declined to 2.49%. India reported 15,220 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,36,54,064.

43.title: 6 members of a family found dead at their home in Jammu
43.article_body: Six members of a family have been found dead under suspicious circumstances at their home in Jammu's Sidhra locality, police said. The bodies have been taken to the Government Medical College and Hospital in the city, the police told news agency PTI. Teams have arrived at the location and are investigating the incident, the police further said.

44.title: Sensex rises 64.90 points to open at 59,907, Nifty at 17,845
44.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Wednesday with Sensex up 64.90 points at 59,907.11 and Nifty at 17,844.70 with a rise of 19.40 points. NTPC, Grasim Industries, BPCL, Hero MotoCorp and Eicher Motors were among the major Nifty gainers, while the stock of HDFC, HDFC Bank, Infosys, TCS and HCL Technologies slipped. Nearly 1,452 shares advanced and 450 shares declined.

45.title: Serena Williams loses to 19-year-old Emma Raducanu in Cincinnati
45.article_body: Twenty three-time singles' Grand Slam champion Serena Williams lost in straight sets to 19-year-old Emma Raducanu in her final WTA tournament at the Cincinnati Open. Raducanu won the game 6-4, 6-0 to move to the second round. "I can't believe I just played Serena...She's just such a legend," said Raducanu after the game.

46.title: I was asked by wife to see Arjun Reddy, stopped after 45 mins: Liger maker
46.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh, whose upcoming film 'Liger' stars actors Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday, said he was "asked" by his "wife" to watch Vijay's film 'Arjun Reddy' which was criticised for toxic masculinity and being misogynistic. "I stopped after watching the movie for 45 minutes," added Jagannadh. "The reason is that...I felt he acted so honestly," he stated.

47.title: Pune records most deaths as swine flu infections rise in Maharashtra
47.article_body: Pune has recorded the most number of deaths at 13, as Maharashtra has witnessed a rise in the number of swine flu cases. Until mid-August, the state witnessed at least 1,449 swine flu cases out of which 43 patients have died so far. After Pune, Nashik has witnessed six deaths, followed by Thane at five and Nagpur at four.

48.title: Rishi Sunak pledges civil service overhaul if elected UK PM
48.article_body: Ex-UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak pledged a major overhaul of the country's civil service to create a "sharper, leaner" bureaucracy if he's elected as UK's next PM. "I'll strengthen civil servants' experience...allow ministers to bring in more external expertise, and bring in performance pay so we have a truly Rolls Royce service delivering for and accountable to...British people," Sunak said.

49.title: Pregnant woman finds knife in her Subway sandwich in UK; shares pics
49.article_body: A pregnant woman has demanded an apology after finding a sharp knife in her Subway sandwich in UK's Suffolk. A Subway spokesperson said that the chain made four attempts to contact Nerice Moyse to resolve the issue but got no response. The spokesperson also said that the staff apologised as soon as they were made aware of the discovery.

50.title: I don't think Dhawan being captain would've bothered KL Rahul: Kaif
50.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said the change in captaincy for the Zimbabwe ODIs could have been "avoided". He added, "If India would have played this series under Shikhar Dhawan, as initially announced, I don't think it would have bothered KL Rahul." Kaif further said, "If someone has been announced as captain, he should remain as captain."

51.title: DMK strong in its ideology, won't compromise with BJP & RSS: Stalin
51.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM and DMK chief MK Stalin on Tuesday said his party is strong in its ideology and it won’t compromise with BJP and RSS. His statement came ahead of his Delhi visit. "There's a relationship between state and Union government and not between DMK and BJP. There's no relationship between parties' ideologies," Stalin added.

52.title: NTPC invites bids from banks to raise ₹5,000 crore term loan
52.article_body: State-run NTPC Limited floated a tender to raise a ₹5,000 crore term loan from banks and financial institutions. The power company will use the proceeds of the loan for capital expenditure, refinancing of loan and other corporate purposes. It added that the minimum loan amount offered by banks or financial institutions should be ₹500 crore or multiples of ₹500 crore.

53.title: DGCA imposes ₹25 lakh fine on 5 helicopter operators from Kedarnath
53.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) imposed a fine of ₹5 lakh each on five helicopter operators ferrying pilgrims to Kedarnath over irregularities in flying records, officials said. The DGCA also suspended officials of two other operators for three months over violation of safety norms, they added. The matter came to light after DGCA conducted an audit in June.

54.title: We're being open & honest about our interests: Jaishankar on India buying Russian oil
54.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar spoke about India's position on buying discounted Russian oil amid Moscow's ongoing war in Ukraine. He said, "We're not doing it in a defensive way. We're being very open and honest about our interests. I have a country which has a per capita income of $2,000...It's my obligation...to...ensure that I get [people] the best deal."

55.title: US President Biden signs $740-billion climate change, healthcare and tax bill into law
55.article_body: US President Joe Biden has signed a $740-billion climate change, healthcare and tax bill into law. The package, known as the Inflation Reduction Act, includes provisions that increase taxes on large corporations, address climate change and lower prescription drug costs. The estimated $740-billion package is made up of $440-billion in new spending and $300-billion towards easing deficits.

56.title: CNG price reduced by ₹6 per kg, PNG by ₹4 per SCM in Mumbai
56.article_body: Mahanagar Gas has reduced the prices of automobile fuel Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and kitchen fuel Piped Natural Gas (PNG) in Mumbai. CNG price has been cut by ₹6 per kg and it will now cost ₹80 per kg. PNG price has been cut by ₹4 per standard cubic metre (SCM) and it will now cost ₹48.50 per SCM.

57.title: Bengaluru's Shivananda Circle flyover partially opens for commuters
57.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Monday opened one stretch of Shivananda Circle flyover for public as a trial run. Earlier, the flyover was expected to be inaugurated on August 15, however, due to recent rainfall, asphalting work on the flyover had not been completed. According to an official, rest of the work will be finished in 12-15 days.

58.title: Swine flu cases increase in Thane, death toll reaches 9
58.article_body: The number of swine flu cases is continuously increasing in Maharashtra's Thane district with the total number of cases going up to 342 and nine succumbing to it. At present, 144 patients are undergoing treatment for swine flu in Thane district which include 112 from Thane, 22 from Kalyan-Dombivali, nine from Navi Mumbai and one from Thane rural.

59.title: Passenger train collides with goods train in Maharashtra's Gondia, over 50 injured
59.article_body: More than 50 persons were injured after three bogies of a train derailed in Maharashtra's Gondia around 2.30 am on Wednesday morning. The accident took place following a collision between a goods train and a passenger train. No casualties have been reported so far. The train was on its way from Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur to Rajasthan's Jodhpur.

60.title: 'This is life', says China on India's concern about its 'spy' ship in Sri Lanka
60.article_body: Asked about India's concerns and the delay in the visit of the 'spy' ship Yuan Wang 5 to Sri Lanka, Beijing's envoy Qi Zhenhong said, "I don't know, you should ask Indian friends...Maybe this is life." China said the activities of its vessel will not affect the security of any country and should not be obstructed by any third party.

61.title: When I saw Mike Tyson on 'Liger' sets, I was like 'Oh f**k he's here': Vijay
61.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda revealed he was unsure if Mike Tyson would turn up for the shoot of his film 'Liger'. "I was in between a take, he was coming in his costume, I was like 'Oh f***, he's actually here'," Vijay added. Ananya Panday further stated Tyson would never sit in a room or a van while on 'Liger' sets.

62.title: 3 men run over by train while changing railway tracks in Gurugram
62.article_body: At least three carpenters, who went for a walk on railway tracks, were run over by a train in Gurugram, police said. "The deceased saw an approaching train...jumped across to the other track, where another passenger train was coming from the opposite direction," police added. "While changing the track, they didn't notice the second train...were run over," police further said.

63.title: Water supply in Hyderabad to be affected today over repair works
63.article_body: Parts of Hyderabad will be facing a water supply cut due to repair and maintenance work undertaken on water pipelines till 6 pm today. About 3.5 lakh residents are expected to be affected. While Mehdipatnam, Kakatiyanagar and Humayun Nagar will face partial cut, a complete water cut will be visible in areas including Mir Alam, Santoshnagar, Narayanguda and Adikmet.

64.title: Ramayan actress Dipika wrongly tags Pakistan PMO in Independence Day tweet
64.article_body: Ramayan actress Dipika Chikhlia wrongly tagged Pakistan PMO in her tweet on India's Independence Day. She shared a picture of herself holding the Tricolour, and wrote, "Happy Independence Day @PakPMO." The actress deleted the tweet after being trolled and posted a video on Instagram.

65.title: Twitter ordered to give Musk fired employee's bot data amid lawsuit
65.article_body: Twitter has been ordered to provide documents from one of its former employees to Elon Musk on bot accounts amid the lawsuit. Kayvon Beykpour, former consumer product head, was fired in May during his paternity leave. Musk's lawyers had requested documents from 22 Twitter employees whom they said had data on Twitter's process of analysing bot accounts.

66.title: I am buying Manchester United: Elon Musk
66.article_body: Tesla Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk on Tuesday said he is buying football club Manchester United. The team is controlled by the American Glazer family, who did not immediately respond to a request for comment. The football club had a market capitalisation of $2.08 billion, as of Tuesday's stock market close.

67.title: Tamil Nadu records 670 new COVID-19 cases, zero fatalities
67.article_body: Tamil Nadu recorded 670 new COVID-19 cases and zero fatalities in the last 24 hours, the Health Department said. So far, 35,60,161 COVID-19 cases have been reported in the state and the death toll remained at 38,033, as per a bulletin. With 927 recoveries in the last 24 hours, currently, there are 6,888 active infections.

68.title: Indian defence attaché now has unescorted access to Pentagon: US
68.article_body: US Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall has said the Indian defence attaché now has unescorted access to the Pentagon. He said the move is in line "with India's status as a major defence partner". "And if you don't think unescorted access to the Pentagon is a big deal, I can't get into the Pentagon without an escort," he said.

69.title: Everyone's become too critical: Huma on boycott culture against B'wood
69.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said people have become "too negative" towards the Hindi film industry. "A few films have not worked and everyone is ready to write everyone's obituary," she said reacting to people's "critical" opinions on recent releases. She asked the audience to be "kinder" and wait for "good films". On the work front, Huma's upcoming release is 'Maharani 2'.

70.title: Shah, Nadda meet Bihar BJP core group as Nitish Kumar expands Cabinet
70.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah and BJP National President JP Nadda attended a Bihar BJP core committee meeting on Tuesday. The leaders were likely to discuss BJP's future course of action and the strategy for 2024 Lok Sabha polls, reports said. The meeting comes on the day CM Nitish Kumar expanded his Cabinet and 31 leaders were sworn-in as ministers.

71.title: Activist Teesta Setalvad moves SC seeking bail in Gujarat riots case
71.article_body: Social activist and journalist Teesta Setalvad has moved the Supreme Court seeking bail in the Gujarat riots case. The court will hear her bail petition on August 22. Setalvad was arrested for allegedly fabricating evidence to frame "innocent people" in the 2002 riots case. Earlier, an Ahmedabad sessions court denied bail to Setalvad and ex-DGP RB Sreekumar in the case.

72.title: Can't wait for audience to see your magic in Adipurush: Kriti to Saif
72.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon on Tuesday wished her 'Adipurush' co-star Saif Ali Khan on his birthday. "Happy Birthday, Saif! It's been a pleasure working with you and getting to know you," she wrote on Instagram Stories. She said she cannot wait for the audience to see Saif's "madness and magic" in 'Adipurush', which also stars Prabhas in a lead role.

73.title: Ajith to shoot AK61's final schedule in Visakhapatnam: Reports
73.article_body: Tamil actor Ajith Kumar has reportedly reached Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh on Tuesday to shoot for the final schedule of his upcoming film, which is tentatively titled 'AK61'. As per the reports, the crew has finished shooting 70% of the film, while they will soon complete the remaining. The H Vinoth directorial will see Ajith in a double role.

74.title: Wimbledon finalist Kyrgios opts out of Australia's Davis Cup team
74.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios has opted out of Australia's Davis Cup finals group stage team for next month. Kyrgios has skipped the team event since 2019. Australia are drawn in Pool C for the September 13-18 finals in Hamburg. "It would've been great to have...Kyrgios in...team but unfortunately he was unavailable for this tie," said team captain Lleyton Hewitt.

75.title: Home decor firm Sunday Design raises ₹12.5 cr in pre-Series A round
75.article_body: Furniture and home decor brand Sunday Design has raised ₹12.5 crore in a pre-Series A funding round. The capital was raised from QRG Investments & Holdings (the family office of Havells India Limited founders), Kama Group (family office of SRF Ltd) and KCT family office, among others. Since its launch, the brand claims to have recorded a 10% month-on-month growth.

76.title: CM Yogi Adityanath-led Cabinet approves UP Jail Manual 2022
76.article_body: The CM Yogi Adityanath-led UP Cabinet on Tuesday approved the proposal to release the UP Jail Manual 2022 which has incorporated guidelines issued by the Central government and courts periodically. This move means the British-era jail manual will be discarded. The old manual had obsolete provisions like transferring prisoners to the Andamans and separate lock-ups for European inmates.

77.title: There's a crisis of confidence in UN system today: Rajnath Singh
77.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, while virtually addressing the Moscow Conference on International Security, said the United Nations (UN) may 'lose its effectiveness' without democratising its decision-making. He said the major powers are refusing to change UN institutions as per the emerging geo-political realities. Singh added that there is a "crisis of confidence" today in the UN system.

78.title: Dearness allowance hiked by 6% for govt employees in Chhattisgarh
78.article_body: Chhattisgarh government on Tuesday announced a 6% hike in the dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees under the 7th Pay Commission. The DA has been hiked by 15% for people under the 6th Pay Commission. This will benefit almost 3.8 lakh people and put an additional burden of ₹2,160 crore/year on the state government exchequer, PTI reported.

79.title: New Polish school textbook draws criticism for fertility passage
79.article_body: A new high school textbook in Poland has attracted criticism from government critics as an attempted "indoctrination of young people". A passage on fertility in the book reads: "Increasingly sophisticated methods...lead to the treatment of sex as entertainment and fertility as human production...who will love the children thus produced?" Poland's Education Ministry has defended the book.

80.title: Both Gill and Dhawan are in good form, they can open in Zimbabwe: Kaif
80.article_body: Mohammad Kaif has said that both Shubman Gill and Shikhar Dhawan can open for India in the upcoming three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe as they are in good form, adding that KL Rahul can come down at number three. "Rahul needs match practice and he was injured...It's his wish where he wants to bat as he is captain," he added.

81.title: Making money is best defence against funding winter: Nandan Nilekani to startups
81.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani said that making money is best defence against funding winter  for startups. He added that startups need to focus on lowering the cost of acquiring customers and asked them to make money organically and not splurge on advertisements. In the wake of investments into India's startup ecosystem, Nilekani also advised companies to prioritise profitability over growth.

82.title: Akshay & Rakul Preet to shoot for a special dance number: Reports
82.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Rakul Preet Singh will reportedly shoot for a special dance number for their upcoming film. A report said that choreographer Ahmed Khan has been roped in to design the song, which will be shot in Kandivali, Mumbai. The film, which is tentatively titled 'Production No 41', is said to be the Hindi remake of Tamil film 'Ratsasan'.

83.title: Great performance: Vijender on Indian boxing contingent's 7 medals at CWG 2022
83.article_body: Olympic bronze medal-winning boxer Vijender Singh praised the Indian boxing contingent's performance at the recently concluded Commonwealth Games 2022, saying they delivered a "great" performance in Birmingham. India won three gold, one silver and three bronze medals. "I'm really proud of them," he added. Nikhat Zareen, Nitu Ghanghas and Amit Panghal won gold medals for India.

84.title: Paytm partners with Samsung, allows buy now, pay later at stores
84.article_body: Paytm has partnered with Samsung stores across the country to allow smart payments through its postpaid or buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) service with a credit limit of up to ₹60,000 per month. Paytm will deploy point-of-sale (POS) devices enabling consumers to purchase Samsung products through its payment instruments. No Cost EMI alternatives will also be available for POS device payments.

85.title: Samyukt Kisan Morcha rejects Centre's MSP panel meeting
85.article_body: The Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) leaders have said that they would not attend the upcoming meeting of the Centre's panel set up for making the Minimum Support Price (MSP) more effective. Calling the meeting a 'farce', the SKM said that it doesn't expect any conclusive result from it. The first meeting of the MSP panel is scheduled for August 22.

86.title: Russia fines Twitch ₹25.9 crore over 31-second 'fake' Ukraine clip
86.article_body: A Russian court has fined California-based streaming service Twitch two million roubles (₹25.9 crore) for allegedly hosting "fake" content related to its military campaign in Ukraine, local media reported. As per the reports, the court accused Twitch of failing to remove a 31-second clip of a girl from the Ukrainian town of Bucha. The content of the video wasn't specified.

87.title: Carlo Ancelotti picks France and Brazil as 2022 World Cup favourites
87.article_body: Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti has picked Brazil and defending champions France as his two favourite sides to win the 2022 FIFA World Cup. He added that Argentina were the other team to look out for because of Lionel Messi, while Spain, England and Germany were the dark horses. The tournament in Qatar will begin on November 20.

88.title: Never talked down to anyone: Bhogle as Ian Chappell retires from commentary
88.article_body: Talking about former Australia captain Ian Chappell retiring from commentary after 45 years, Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Never pulled a punch, told it as it is, never talked down to anyone, wonderful professional & my role model for broadcasting work ethic." He added, "Was a privilege to work with him & I hope that proud voice is always heard."

89.title: 'Krrish 4' to introduce new characters: Reports
89.article_body: Hrithik Roshan's 'Krrish 4' will reportedly introduce new characters along with some new action sequences. As per reports, Rakesh Roshan is developing the script and is currently working on the crucial part of the story. The reports also claim that the new film will continue from where the third part of the superhero franchise ended.

90.title: Now it's cool: Kareena on notion that marriage ends actress' career
90.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has shared that people no more think that a marriage can end an actress' career. She said they now feel "it's cool to be married". Recalling how she was warned about her career before marrying Saif Ali Khan, Kareena said she "wanted to get married at that point of time" and it was not planned.

91.title: Fintech unicorn Razorpay acquires POS machines provider Ezetap
91.article_body: Razorpay, the B2B payments aggregator and neo-banking platform, has acquired point-of-sale (POS) machines provider Ezetap in a mix of primary and secondary transactions. With 80% stake in the parent company of Ezetap, this is Razorpay's fifth acquisition in four years. According to regulatory filings, Bengaluru-based Ezetap's early investor, Helion Ventures still has minority stake in the company.

92.title: ABTYP to hold world's biggest blood donation drive on PM's birthday
92.article_body: Akhil Bhartiya Terapanth Yuvak Parishad (ABTYP) is planning the world's biggest blood donation drive for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's birthday on September 17. The Parishad's President Pankaj Daga said they plan to set up 1,000 camps across India aiming to collect three lakh units of blood. A BJP leader present at the event said the party would support the drive.

93.title: Maha govt announces singing of national anthem at 11 am on Wed
93.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced a collective singing of the national anthem at 11 am on Wednesday (August 17) across the state. As per the government resolution, participation is mandatory for government and private schools, colleges, educational institutes, university teachers and students. Further, the government has appealed to everyone from the state to join the event.

94.title: What does the FIFA suspension mean for Indian football?
94.article_body: With FIFA suspending AIFF, all domestic leagues in India stand officially unrecognised. Indian men's football team's friendly matches against Vietnam and Singapore will be cancelled if suspension isn't revoked. FIFA said 2022 Under-17 Women’s World Cup "cannot be held in India as planned". Indian Women's League champions Gokulam Kerala might also be barred from AFC Women’s Club Championship.

95.title: Madras HC gives actor Vijay temporary relief in income tax case
95.article_body: The Madras High Court has temporarily stayed the Income Tax Department's orders imposing a ₹1.5 crore penalty on actor Vijay for not disclosing ₹15 crore income in his 2016-17 IT returns. The court agreed with Vijay's arguments that the punitive action was time-barred. The department imposed the penalty after conducting a raid at the actor's residence in 2020.

96.title: We'll have our own show 'Cutting with Kashyap', jokes Anurag
96.article_body: Taapsee Pannu and Anurag Kashyap have shared why they will not make an appearance on Koffee with Karan season 7, hosted by Karan Johar. Kashyap joked that he will make a budget-friendly show of his own called 'Cutting With Kashyap'. He also suggested 'Tharra With Taapsee' and 'Panna With Pannu' as the titles for Taapsee's talk show.

97.title: Kejriwal promises free, quality education in poll-bound Gujarat
97.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said quality education will be provided free of cost if the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) wins the assembly elections in Gujarat. The AAP convener vowed to improve the infrastructure of government schools and open new ones. In earlier visits to poll-bound Gujarat, Kejriwal announced pre-poll guarantees on electricity, unemployment allowance and women's welfare.

98.title: Crystal Palace defender gets death threats over Liverpool striker's red card
98.article_body: Crystal Palace defender Joachim Andersen said he received death threats after his altercation with Liverpool's Darwin Nunez led to the striker getting a red card. "Got maybe 300-400 of these messages last night...have some respect and stop (acting) tough online," said Andersen on Instagram. Liverpool were held to a 1-1 draw as Nunez was sent off for head-butting Andersen.

99.title: I still think about Hamilton's 2021 championship loss every day: Toto Wolff
99.article_body: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff admitted he still thinks about last year's Abu Dhabi Grand Prix where Lewis Hamilton lost the world championship to Red Bull's Max Verstappen on the last lap. "I think about it every day. But I have my peace with Max winning," said Wolff. He added he was happy with the FIA's new President and transparency.

100.title: 18 foetuses found at municipal dumping ground in West Bengal's Howrah
100.article_body: Ragpickers scavenging through waste found at least 18 foetuses in a municipal dumping yard in West Bengal's Howrah district, 40 km west of Kolkata, police said on Tuesday. Local residents said there are at least 30 hospitals and nursing homes within the yard's two-km radius. "Foetuses have been sent for postmortem. An investigation is going on," a police officer said.

101.title: Law making period products free for all takes effect in Scotland
101.article_body: Scotland said it has become the world's first country to ensure period products are available free of charge to all persons who need them. Scotland's Period Products Act came into force on Monday. Under the law, colleges, schools and local government bodies must make period products, such as tampons and sanitary pads, available in their bathrooms free of cost.

102.title: We are going to miss him: Dhawan on Sundar being ruled out of Zimbabwe tour
102.article_body: Commenting on Washington Sundar being ruled out of India's tour of Zimbabwe due to a shoulder injury, India vice-captain Shikhar Dhawan said the team is going to miss the all-rounder. "At the same time, we've got a good backup as well," he added. Sundar has been replaced by 27-year-old all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed. India-Zimbabwe will be playing three ODIs in Harare.

103.title: Stupid to ignore: England's Billings on Elgar questioning 'Bazball'
103.article_body: England wicketkeeper Sam Billings responded to South African batter Dean Elgar questioning the longevity of 'Bazball', saying, "You'd be pretty stupid to ignore that if I'm honest." He added that South Africa's defeat in the practice match should be a "wake-up call" as it wasn't even England's main XI. Elgar had said that 'Bazball' could "go south very quickly".

104.title: Looking forward to more work on OTT, but will never shut doors to TV: Drashti
104.article_body: Actress Drashti Dhami said she is glad that OTT has welcomed her so nicely and is looking forward to more work on the platform. She, however, added, "I can never shut my doors to TV, but right now, I'm just going with the flow." She further said, "In TV, we don't get to prepare for a role, here, we do."

105.title: Man walks into Assam police station with severed head
105.article_body: A man walked into a police station in Assam's Sonitpur district with a severed head, an official said on Tuesday. Tuniram Madri allegedly beheaded fellow villager Hem Ram after he lost a ₹500 bet on a local football match on Monday. Hem kept demanding the money and Tuniram killed him in a fit of rage, the official added.

106.title: 5 militants involved in IED blasts arrested in Manipur's Thoubal
106.article_body: Police said five militants of the banned outfit People's Liberation Army (PLA) involved in two Improvised Explosive Device (IED) blasts were arrested in Manipur's Thoubal district on Tuesday. A cordon and search operation was conducted at Tentha Tuwaband, during which three militants were arrested, Thoubal SP said. As a follow up operation, two more militants were also arrested, he added.

107.title: Assam woman realises flag in her closet is 90 yrs old, was used during freedom struggle
107.article_body: Assam's Kiron Rajhowa recently realised that the flag that has been in her possession for 40 years is 90 years old and was used during the freedom struggle by freedom fighter Podmeshwar Rajkhowa. Kiron's daughter-in-law Dolly realised the flag's heritage when it was given to Dolly's daughter. "We feel proud and privileged to have preserved this," Dolly said.

108.title: Gold worth ₹1.21 cr seized at Chennai airport from multiple incidents
108.article_body: Over two kg of gold worth ₹1.21 crore was seized from multiple incidents at the airport in Chennai, the Customs Department said on Tuesday. In one of the incidents, officials confiscated gold from a passenger who had concealed it in his rectum, the press release said. Electronic goods valued at ₹90,000 were recovered from all the incidents, the release added.

109.title: 'Uber charged ₹3,000 from Delhi airport to my house which was 45km away,' claims man
109.article_body: A Noida resident claimed that Uber charged him ₹2,935 for a cab from Delhi airport to his home, which was around 45 km away. "I was billed for 147.39 kms - halfway to Jaipur that I apparently covered in little over an hour!" he tweeted. "This, when...booking amount was ₹1,143. Pick-up and drop locations are inaccurate too!" the man added.

110.title: Tamil Nadu's DMK moves SC, challenges definition of 'freebies'
110.article_body: Tamil Nadu's ruling party DMK on Tuesday moved SC, challenging the definition of 'freebies'. The court is hearing a petition that has challenged the promise of freebies at election time, contending that the practice can bring financial ruin on a state. The DMK argued that free services are introduced with an intent to secure a "social order and economic justice".

111.title: 17-year-old Indian Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa defeats junior world number 1 Firouzja
111.article_body: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa opened his campaign in the FTX Crypto Cup by defeating the junior world number one Alireza Firouzja. Praggnanandhaa won the four-game tie 2.5-1.5. He registered victories in the opening and the third game. He lost the second game, while the fourth game ended in a draw. He picked up three points for beating Firouzja.

112.title: Talaq-e-Hasan doesn't seem improper, women can opt for 'Khula' divorce: SC
112.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday observed that the Islamic practice of Talaq-e-Hasan, in which a man can divorce his wife by pronouncing 'talaq' once a month for three months, is "Prima Facie...not so improper". A two-judge bench said, "(In the practice,) women also have an option. 'Khula' is there." As per Islamic law, women can divorce their husbands through 'Khula'.

113.title: Adani Transmission becomes 15th Indian firm to cross ₹4 trillion in m-cap
113.article_body: Adani Transmission on Tuesday hit ₹4 trillion in market capitalisation for the first time after its shares rallied over 104% in 2022. It is the 15th Indian listed firm and the second Adani Group company to achieve this milestone. Adani Green Energy had become the first Adani Group company to reach ₹4 trillion in m-cap earlier this year.

114.title: PV Sindhu's coach Park Tae-sang leaves for Korea for back treatment
114.article_body: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu's coach Park Tae-sang has left for South Korea for back treatment. The 43-year-old revealed on Instagram that he had hurt his back during CWG 2022. "I'll get well treated and come back healthy. Stay healthy, everyone," he wrote. Earlier, Sindhu pulled out of Badminton World Championships due to a stress fracture on her foot.

115.title: Which 15 Indian companies have reached ₹4 trillion in m-cap?
115.article_body: Adani Transmission today became the 15th Indian company to reach ₹4 trillion in m-cap. It's the second Adani Group firm after Adani Green Energy to attain the milestone. Other Indian companies to reach ₹4 trillion in m-cap include Reliance Industries, TCS, HDFC Bank, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever, ICICI Bank, LIC, HDFC, SBI, Bajaj Finance, Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank and ITC.

116.title: Hope Team India can bank on me: Shahbaz after being picked for Zimbabwe tour
116.article_body: Reacting to his maiden India call-up in upcoming three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, 27-year-old all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed said, "Everybody who plays cricket wants to wear the India colours." He added, "Given a chance I hope I can win matches for India with my batting and bowling. I hope...team can bank on me." Shahbaz replaced Washington Sundar following his shoulder injury.

117.title: Top Malaysian court orders former PM Najib to begin final appeal
117.article_body: Malaysia's top court has ordered former PM Najib Razak to begin his final appeal in two days in the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) state fund scandal. The court rejected Najib's request for dismissal of his conviction and 12-year sentence over alleged judicial bias. Investigators have alleged that $4.5 billion was stolen from the 1MDB fund and laundered by Najib's associates.

118.title: 20-yr-old man dies after tree falls on him in UP's Firozabad
118.article_body: Police said that a 20-year-old aspirant preparing for a competitive examination, identified as Abhishek, died when a tree fell on him in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad on Tuesday. The incident took place while the victim was returning from his coaching classes. The tree fell on Abhishek due to high-speed wind near Labhua village, SP (rural) Akhilesh Narayan said.

119.title: Flood situation in Madhya Pradesh under control: CM Shivraj Chouhan
119.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said that the flood situation in the state is currently under control. While assessing the flood situation, the CM said that due to excess rain, all dams in the Narmada catchment have been submerged. Talking about the state government's efforts, he added that many people were rescued from Vidisha and Balaghat districts.

120.title: Stale meat seized from Chennai mall's restaurants after surprise raid
120.article_body: After a surprise raid at multiple restaurants located inside a mall in Chennai's Anna Nagar, food safety authorities on Tuesday seized stale meat from a couple of them. "We received a complaint on Monday of poor quality food served at a restaurant here, in which a worm was found," said Dr Satheesh Kumar, who was leading the team of officials.

121.title: Losses from crypto hacks from Jan to Jul rose 60% YoY to $1.9 bn: Report
121.article_body: Losses arising from crypto hacks in 2022's first seven months jumped nearly 60% YoY to $1.9 billion, propelled by a surge in funds stolen from decentralised finance (DeFi) protocols, according to Chainalysis. In the same period last year, funds stolen from hacking amounted to $1.2 billion. "DeFi protocols are uniquely vulnerable to hacking," Chainalysis said in a blog post.

122.title: BJP doing double standard politics: Siddaramaiah on Shivamogga clashes
122.article_body: After communal clashes were reported in Karnataka's Shivamogga over the removal of Veer Savarkar's banner, Congress leader Siddaramaiah criticised BJP and accused it of being involved in double standard politics. "Why did they put Savarkar's photo in a Muslim area and remove Tipu Sultan's portrait?" Siddaramaiah questioned. "First BJP does all these things and blames Congress," Siddaramaiah added.

123.title: Mahagathbandhan formed out of selfish interests: Giriraj Singh
123.article_body: After the Bihar Cabinet expansion, Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised the newly formed Mahagathbandhan and said this alliance is formed out of "selfish interests". "Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD in 2017. Now, for some reason or the other, he has gone back with RJD," Singh said. Nitish wishes to become a candidate for Prime Minister's post, Singh added.

124.title: Leave Kashmir or get killed: Kashmiri Pandit body to community
124.article_body: The Kashmiri Pandit Sangarash Samiti (KPSS) asked the community to leave the Valley after the targeted killing of a Kashmiri Pandit farmer by militants in Shopian. The KPSS President said that Pandits have "only one option- to leave Kashmir or get killed by religiously fanatic minds". He urged Kashmiri Pandits to move to safer places like Jammu and Delhi.

125.title: Bilkis rape convicts freed hrs after PM's women safety speech: Cong
125.article_body: Congress spokesman Pawan Khera on Tuesday said that hours after PM Narendra Modi spoke about women's safety and respect on Independence Day, Gujarat government released 11 people convicted in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. "Who's the real Narendra Modi? The one who serves falsehood from...the Red Fort or the one who gets his Gujarat government to release [rapists]?" Khera asked.

126.title: London’s Heathrow Airport increases limit on number of daily flyers
126.article_body: Amid a shortage of staff, London's Heathrow Airport has extended its limit on the number of passengers flying out daily to cope with soaring demand from travellers. The airport said a maximum of 100,000 flyers can depart from its terminals each day till October 29. As per initial plans, the daily cap was expected to be lifted on September 11.

127.title: KL Rahul will gain a lot from Zimbabwe tour ahead of Asia Cup 2022: Dhawan
127.article_body: India vice-captain Shikhar Dhawan said KL Rahul will gain a lot from India's tour of Zimbabwe ahead of Asia Cup 2022. Rahul is returning to international cricket in the upcoming ODI series after not having played in any format of cricket following IPL 2022 due to fitness issues. Rahul will lead India in the three-match series in Harare, beginning Thursday.

128.title: Wanted Chinese online gambling operator arrested in Thailand
128.article_body: Thai police on Monday told Reuters that they had arrested a Chinese fugitive wanted by Beijing over allegations of running illegal online gambling operations. The process to extradite 40-year-old She Zhijiang to China is underway, police added. She Zhijiang was arrested last week based on an international warrant and an Interpol red notice, a police spokesperson informed.

129.title: Your heart breaks: Gaurav on his role being chopped in 'Bachchhan Paandey'
129.article_body: Actor Gaurav Chopraa opened up about his role being chopped in 'Bachchhan Paandey' and said, "Aapka dil thoda tutt ta hain (your heart breaks)...Didn’t know what to say about it." "There were a few things that I did jiske liye taaliyan baji set pe (that were applauded on the set)...you want that to reach the audience," he said.

130.title: 6 injured in clash in Assam's Lakhimpur; AASU stages road blockade
130.article_body: A group of miscreants allegedly attacked a Village Defence Party (VDP) in Assam's Lakhimpur district, injuring six VDP members in the area bordering Arunachal Pradesh. Following the incident, the All Assam Students' Union (AASU) staged a road blockade along the main highway leading to Arunachal Pradesh.

131.title: Not going to be easy: Maninder on Deepak Chahar's India comeback
131.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Maninder Singh said that the Indian team management should handle Deepak Chahar with care as it'll not be easy for the pacer to make a comeback in international cricket after returning from a hamstring injury. Chahar, who hasn't played since February 2022 due to injury, is named in India's 15-member squad for upcoming three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe.

132.title: All Tyagis aren't bad, I trust PM and Yogi: Woman abused by Shrikant
132.article_body: Days after a Noida woman was abused and pushed by alleged BJP member Shrikant Tyagi, the woman posted a video saying not all 'Tyagis' are bad and that she trusts PM Modi and Yogi Adityanath. "Aisa nahi hai ki saare BJP waale kharab hai," she said, adding that PM Modi and Yogi Adityanath have done wonders for the country.

133.title: Men plant bomb under Punjab Sub-Inspector's car, act caught on CCTV
133.article_body: Punjab Sub-Inspector Dilbag Singh on Tuesday said that a bomb was planted under his car in Amritsar. A CCTV footage showed two men arriving on a motorcycle and purportedly planting the bomb under the parked car. "I've worked during militancy...that is why they [planted the bomb]," Singh said. "Police recovered the IED...Further probe underway," Manish Chawla, IG Border Range, said.

134.title: Can’t let our guards down: Delhi L-G as COVID-19 cases rise again
134.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has appealed to the people to 'not let their guards down' as the COVID-19 pandemic is "far from over". "We are witnessing a rise in COVID-19 infections...We cannot afford to let our guards down," tweeted Saxena. Delhi, on Monday, logged 1,227 fresh COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 14.57%.

135.title: Which Made-in-India weapons were handed over to the Indian Army today?
135.article_body: Several indigenously-developed defence systems and weapons were handed over by the Defence Minister to the Army, including the F-INSAS, the Nipun anti-personnel mines and the Landing Craft Assault (LCA). The F-INSAS (Future Infantry Soldier As A System) aims to increase the operational capability of a soldier. The LCA will be used as a replacement for boats in Ladakh's Pangong Tso.

136.title: Man who blackmailed Urfi Javed for cyber sex, threatened to cyber rape her arrested
136.article_body: Actress and 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed on Tuesday said in an interview that the man who blackmailed her for cyber sex and threatened to cyber rape her has been arrested. She also took to Instagram Stories to share the picture of the man and thanked Mumbai Police. Urfi had alleged the man had been harassing her for years.

137.title: US needs conflicts to retain hegemony: Putin on Ukraine war
137.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday accused the US of encouraging extended hostilities in Ukraine so as to maintain its global hegemony. Putin said, "They need conflicts to retain their hegemony...That's why they have turned the Ukrainian people into cannon fodder." Putin was speaking at a security conference attended by representatives from Asia, Africa and Latin America.

138.title: BJP misusing paramilitary, police to transport money: Raj CM
138.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday accused BJP of misusing paramilitary and police forces to transport money to its party headquarters. "Even if a road is made of gold, just bring Hindu-Muslim angle during elections and win. They are in this arrogance, which will not last long," he said. "Pett roti maangta hai," CM Gehlot added.

139.title: 2019 corporate tax rate cut led to ₹1.84L cr revenue loss: Congress
139.article_body: Congress on Tuesday asked why the BJP government reduced the corporate tax rate from 30% to 22% in 2019. Quoting a Parliamentary estimates report, Congress spokesperson Gaurav Vallabh said the reduction led to a negative revenue impact of ₹1.84 lakh crore. "Why are such rate cuts limited to corporates, why the middle class is taxed at...30%," he asked.

140.title: Gemini North telescope captures image of 2 galaxies merging
140.article_body: The Gemini North telescope in Hawai'i captured a brilliant image of a pair of spiral galaxies, NGC 4568 and NGC 4567, merging into one another. Both the galaxies that are entangled in their mutual gravitational fields may eventually combine to form a single elliptical galaxy in around 500 million years. The cosmic collision took place approximately 60 million light-years away.

141.title: Malayalam actor Nedumbram Gopi dies at 85
141.article_body: Veteran Malayalam actor Nedumbram Gopi, 85, passed away on Tuesday due to age-related ailments. He made his acting debut with the award-winning film 'Kazhcha', which also starred Mammooty in the lead role. In the Blessy directorial, Nedumbram Gopi played the role of a father and a grandfather for which he received wide appreciation.

142.title: Delhi-bound Taj Express evacuated, searched after fake bomb threat
142.article_body: Passengers of the Delhi-bound Taj Express were asked to deboard at Mathura and the train was searched for two hours after a passenger received a bomb threat. Police said the caller claimed a bomb was placed in Taj Express' D2 coach and that it would explode when the train reached Delhi. A 45-year-old man has been arrested in the matter.

143.title: Akshay wishes Saif on b'day by dancing on 'Main Khiladi...' song
143.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar wished Saif Ali Khan on his birthday with a video wherein he can be seen performing on 'Main Khiladi Tu Anari' song, which he is recreating for his upcoming film 'Selfiee'. Sharing the video on Instagram, Akshay said the song "brings back fondest memories", especially of his "partner-in-crime" Saif. The original song starred Akshay and Saif.

144.title: Over 5,500 cases of discrimination reported in Germany in 2021
144.article_body: Germany's Anti-Discrimination Commissioner Ferda Ataman on Tuesday said 5,617 cases of discrimination were reported in the country in 2021, which was the second highest figure for a 12-month period since the agency's inception in 2006. Of all cases, 37% were connected to race and 32% were related to disability and diseases. "The number of discrimination cases...is alarming," Ataman said.

145.title: Savarkar's poster torn in K'taka's Tumakuru day after clashes in Shivamogga
145.article_body: A group of men allegedly tore down a banner that had a photo of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar in Karnataka's Tumakuru city on Tuesday. The incident comes a day after communal clashes were reported in Shivamogga district after another group removed a poster of Savarkar and put up one of Tipu Sultan on Independence Day.

146.title: Centre considering transfer of 4 Gujarat villages to UT of Dadra
146.article_body: The Union Home Ministry is holding discussions to transfer four villages and a piece of land from Gujarat to the Union Territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu. Meghval, Nagar, Raymal and Madhuban villages in South Gujarat are more accessible from Diu. The Union Territory has demanded the land in Saurashtra to develop a fishing port.

147.title: Felt like a princess: Arjun Kanungo's wife Carla on mehndi outfit
147.article_body: South African model Carla Dennis, who recently got married to Indian singer Arjun Kanungo, chose to wear designer Anita Dongre's creation for her mehndi function. Describing her fuchsia pink outfit, Carla said, "I loved it the minute I saw it." She said she "felt like an absolute princess" in the lehenga. Carla and Arjun got married on August 10.

148.title: Sabotage behind ammunition depot blast in Crimea, says Russia
148.article_body: Russia has blamed saboteurs for the series of explosions that hit an ammunition depot in annexed Crimea on Tuesday. This comes as a rare admission by Russia that pro-Ukraine groups are damaging its military infrastructure in territories under its control. Notably, Kyiv had hinted at a possible Ukrainian involvement in explosions that rocked a Russian-operated airbase in Crimea last week.

149.title: 2 men detained over murder of CPI(M) worker in Kerala's Palakkad
149.article_body: Two men have been detained in connection with the murder of 40-year-old CPI(M) worker K Shajahan in Kerala's Palakkad district. "We have...got a definite lead about six others who directly participated in the crime," Palakkad SP R Viswanadh said. "The real motive behind the crime can be established only after a detailed investigation," the SP added.

150.title: US First Lady Jill Biden tests positive for COVID-19
150.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden tested positive for COVID-19 after developing cold-like symptoms late on Monday evening, her communications director Elizabeth Alexander said on Tuesday. After testing negative earlier on Monday as part of her regular testing cadence, a PCR test taken after she developed symptoms came back positive. She is only experiencing mild symptoms.

151.title: Tencent stops sales on its NFT platform Huanhe a year after launch
151.article_body: Tencent on Tuesday announced that its non-fungible token (NFT) platform Huanhe will no longer release digital collectibles. Tencent said users of Huanhe, launched in August 2021, will still be able to hold, display or request for refund of their existing collectibles. Huanhe is making adjustments to its business based on its consideration to focus on its core strategy, Tencent said.

152.title: Restoration underway after Lucknow's Bara Imambara dome collapses
152.article_body: The restoration work on the dome of Lucknow's Bara Imambara, which collapsed on Monday evening, is currently underway. An Archaeological Survey of India official said that the work on the small structure will be completed in a day or two. The dome collapsed due to heavy rainfall and wind around 6 pm on Monday.

153.title: 'Vulgar' songs played in IIT-BHU after flag hoisting, probe ordered
153.article_body: 'Vulgar' Bhojpuri songs were allegedly played after the Independence Day flag hoisting ceremony at the Indian Institute of Technology- Banaras Hindu University (IIT-BHU). The administration has ordered a probe into the incident. An official said that after the ceremony, some youths played 'vulgar' Bhojpuri songs and danced before the staff paused the music and asked that the venue be evacuated.

154.title: Anurag Kashyap shares pic with ex-wives Kalki Koechlin & Aarti Bajaj, says 'My 2 pillars'
154.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap took to Instagram on Tuesday to share a picture with his ex-wives Kalki Koechlin and Aarti Bajaj. "My two pillars," he wrote in the caption of the post. While Anurag and Aarti were married from 1997 to 2009, the director and Kalki were married from 2011 and 2015. "Iconic," commented Aaliyah Kashyap, Anurag's daughter with Aarti.

155.title: It hurt him, really tore him to shreds: Karthik on Rohit being dropped from Tests in 2018
155.article_body: Recalling the time when Rohit Sharma was dropped from India's Test squad for England tour in 2018, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "He was sent back after the white-ball leg and that really hurt him." "Rohit did not see that coming and that really tore him to shreds," the 37-year-old added.

156.title: Drunk guard caught molesting girls at Delhi hostel, CCTV footage emerges
156.article_body: An intoxicated security guard molested and thrashed girls at a PG hostel in Delhi's Karol Bagh, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal said on Tuesday. She also shared CCTV footage of the alleged incident where the guard is seen molesting a girl who is seen resisting. DCW has issued a notice to police, Maliwal said.

157.title: Zimbabwe playing good cricket, will keep us on our toes: Dhawan ahead of 1st ODI
157.article_body: Ahead of the first India-Zimbabwe ODI in Harare, India vice-captain Shikhar Dhawan said the hosts are playing good cricket and it will keep the visitors on their toes. "We would not take anything for granted. We are here to perform," he added. First ODI will be played on Thursday. Zimbabwe won the recently concluded three-match ODI series against Bangladesh 2-1.

158.title: 30% shows of 'Laal...' & 'Raksha Bandhan' cancelled due to no audience
158.article_body: Around 30% of the morning shows of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' were reportedly cancelled by the exhibitors across the country on Tuesday due to no audience. "It's a dark black weekend," an exhibitor said as quoted by Bollywood Hungama, "Both Aamir Khan and Akshay Kumar have to introspect on their choices of films," the exhibitor added.

159.title: Mandla is India's first functionally literate district: MP Minister
159.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's tribal-dominated Mandla has become India's first "functionally literate" district, declared state minister Bisahulal Singh. The District Collector said it was the result of a campaign launched after locals complained of being defrauded due to illiteracy. A person can be called functionally literate when they are able to write their own name, count, read and write in Hindi.

160.title: 3 techies, cab driver returning from Udaipur trip die in car crash
160.article_body: Three techies, who visited Udaipur for a trip, died while returning after a speeding truck struck their cab in Gurugram on Tuesday. The 35-year-old cab driver from Noida also died in the crash. One of the deceased's friends, who was also in the vehicle, has sustained multiple injuries, police said. The truck lost control and overturned on the victims' vehicle.

161.title: If I lose 2,000 points, I'll start again: US Open defending champ Raducanu
161.article_body: Speaking about the pressure of having to defend 2,000 ranking points at upcoming US Open, defending champion Emma Raducanu said, "If I lose 2,000 points so be it, I'll start again from the bottom." She added, "I know I can do something that no one else has done. I qualified and won...US Open, so I can start from the beginning."

162.title: PETA seeks to ban dog breeding for illegal fighting in UP
162.article_body: The People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) India has asked to ban the keeping, breeding and sale of dogs for illegal fighting in Uttar Pradesh. PETA has also asked that illegal pet shops and breeders be shut down. According to the organisation, the ban can be achieved by owners mandatorily sterilising the breeds placed on the prohibited list.

163.title: Shameful: Anupam Kher on Kashmiri Pandit man's killing
163.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher condemned the killing of a Kashmiri Pandit man by terrorists in Kashmir's Shopian and said, "(It's) shameful that atrocities on Kashmiri Pandits continue...They're killing their own people." He added that terrorists were "killing everyone who stands with India". Kher said the more the actions were condemned, "the less it is" and that mindset needs to be changed.

164.title: Bollywood stars should reduce fee for focus on good cinema: BJP
164.article_body: Responding to reports of several Hindi films underperforming at the box office, BJP's Syed Zafar Islam on Tuesday said that Bollywood stars should reduce their fee to allow producers to focus on good cinema. "Remember, OTT is a better and cost-effective option available to people", he said, adding that the full industry is going through a lean phase post-COVID-19.

165.title: Air India announces launch of direct flight between Pune & Ahmedabad
165.article_body: Air India has announced the launch of direct flight between Pune and Ahmedabad with effect from August 20, 2022, to cater to the growing demand for air connectivity between the smart cities. "This new addition is set to improve Air India's domestic connectivity and empower our customers with more travel options," MD and CEO of Air India Campbell Wilson stated.

166.title: 6-yr-old raped & murdered in Haryana's Panipat, migrant worker held
166.article_body: A 40-year-old migrant worker was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly raping and murdering a six-year-old girl in Haryana's Panipat. Police said the accused hailed from Uttarakhand's Chamoli and was living in Panipat for 15 years. The accused said he lured the girl on the pretext of buying her biscuits while she was playing and took her to a deserted place.

167.title: Rhine's low water levels threatening industry: German lobby group
167.article_body: Amid drought in Europe, Germany's main industry lobby group on Tuesday said that factories may have to slow down production or cease it completely as Rhine river's dwindling water levels are hampering transportation of cargo. Lobby group BDI further said that transporting cargo through other means was difficult due to limited rail capacity and a lack of drivers.

168.title: Serena Williams is one of the greatest athletes, male or female: McEnroe
168.article_body: Praising Serena Williams, ex-world number one John McEnroe said the 23-time Grand Slam champion, for him, is the greatest female athlete in the history of sports. "I don't care who you could come up with. She's one of the greatest athletes period, male or female," he added. The 40-year-old will be retiring after the US Open 2022.

169.title: Plane from India with 12 people lands in Pak for unknown reason: Report
169.article_body: A charter airplane carrying 12 passengers from India landed at Pakistan's Jinnah International Airport in Karachi on August 15, Geo News reported. The flight took off shortly after arriving in Karachi, with 12 passengers on board. Confirming the incident, a Civil Aviation Authority spokesperson said the flight had no connection with Pakistan. It's unclear why it had landed in Karachi.

170.title: New study reveals when the Sun is estimated to die
170.article_body: The Sun at the centre of our solar system is "currently in its comfortable middle age", new data from the European Space Agency's (ESA) GAIA spacecraft has said. The current age of the Sun is estimated to be 4.57 billion years, data showed. It will die after becoming a red giant star when it's around 10-11 billion years old.

171.title: Doesn't seem Dalit boy was thrashed for touching water pot: Raj Police
171.article_body: The nine-year-old Dalit boy, who died after he was beaten up at his school in Rajasthan, doesn't appear to have been thrashed for touching his teacher's drinking water pot, Jalore SP HV Agarwalla said. "Most of the students in the school are from SC/ST communities and so is half the staff," said Jogeshwar Garg, BJP MLA from Jalore.

172.title: 40-yr-old Ghaziabad builder cheats 31 investors of over ₹10 cr, held
172.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested from West Delhi by officers of the Economic Offences Wing of the Delhi Police last week, for allegedly cheating 31 investors of over ₹10 crore, police said on Tuesday. The accused's company took money from people for shops and flats at a plot in Haryana but escaped after promising possession within 27 months to investors.

173.title: 1,100 Rohingya refugees living in Delhi tents to be shifted to flats
173.article_body: Around 1,100 Rohingya refugees, currently residing in tents in Delhi's Madanpur Khadar area,  will be shifted into New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) flats, officials said on Tuesday. The decision was taken at a meeting chaired by Chief Secretary of Delhi Naresh Kumar. The flats, located in Bakkarwala village, will be equipped with basic amenities and round-the-clock security, officials said.

174.title: Rohit asked to go inside restaurant after massive crowd gathers to see him, video viral
174.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a massive crowd gathering outside a restaurant in Mumbai to get a glimpse of Team India captain Rohit Sharma.
