In the video, Rohit can be seen exiting the restaurant and being immediately asked by the security personnel to go inside due to the amount of people blocking the road.

175.title: Nitish betrayed Tejashwi Yadav too: Sushil Modi after cabinet expansion
175.article_body: After the cabinet expansion of the newly formed Mahagathbandhan government in Bihar, BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi said Nitish Kumar has betrayed Tejashwi Yadav by keeping Home and Finance portfolios with the JD(U). "What message does Nitish Kumar want to give by keeping people like Surendra Yadav, Ramanand Yadav and Lalit Yadav in the cabinet," Sushil Modi tweeted.

176.title: Around 600 Chinese manjha rolls seized in Delhi, 5 shopkeepers held
176.article_body: Five men were arrested by Northeast Delhi Police Saturday, for allegedly possessing and selling nearly 600 rolls of banned Chinese manjha in the Jafrabad and Bhajanpura areas. One of the accused reportedly confessed that he had been collecting the manjha rolls from his sources for some time so that he could sell them at a higher rate on Independence Day.

177.title: Liquor shop cashier hacked to death in TN; incident caught on camera
177.article_body: A video showing a group of miscreants murdering a state-owned liquor store's cashier on Monday in Tamil Nadu's Sirumugai has surfaced online. According to reports, many men holding machetes and knives stormed the wine store where the victim worked. The video shows approximately six assailants attacking the victim with sharp-edged instruments, who then allegedly hacked him to death.

178.title: Delhi court acquits man from charges of possessing heroin, liquor
178.article_body: A Delhi court has acquitted a man, accused of carrying illicit liquor and possessing heroin, saying there were "major contradictions" in the deposition of the prosecution witnesses. Special Judge Deepak Wason, in an order, also said that the police showed "deliberate disregard" of the statutory procedures during its probe and gave the accused benefit of the doubt.

179.title: Drugs worth ₹1,026 cr seized after Mumbai Police busts mephedrone unit
179.article_body: Mumbai Police have busted a mephedrone, or MD, manufacturing unit in Gujarat and seized 513 kg of the synthetic drug worth ₹1,026 crore, an official said on Tuesday. The Anti-Narcotics Cell also arrested Giriraj Dixit, the owner of the drug unit who holds a master's degree in Chemistry. The unit was raided on August 13 and was located in Ankleshwar.

180.title: 2 killed as truck hits bike in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun
180.article_body: Two people were killed when a light-duty truck hit a motorcycle in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun, police said on Tuesday. According to the police, the accident took place late on Monday night near Lahra village. The deceased were identified as 50-year-old Chandrapal Shakya and 30-year-old Avnish Yadav, both residents of Dhakpura village, Station House Officer Ram Avtar Singh said.

181.title: NIA court sends JMI student with ISIS links to 30-day custody
181.article_body: An NIA court on Tuesday sent Mohsin Ahmad, a student of Jamia Millia Islamia and an active ISIS member, to judicial custody for 30 days. "Ahmad is a radicalised and active member of ISIS. He has been arrested for his involvement in the collection of funds for ISIS from sympathisers in India as well as abroad," the NIA statement said.

182.title: Raju Srivastava still on ventilator, condition slowly improving: Manager
182.article_body: Raju Srivastava is still on ventilator, but his condition is improving slowly, the comedian's Business Manager, Nayan Soni, said. "There's an improvement in his health...he can now move his body parts a bit," Nayan said. "Doctors have informed...it'll take about a week for him to regain consciousness," he added. Raju is undergoing treatment at AIIMS, Delhi, following a heart attack.

183.title: Take strict action: NCPCR to Rajasthan govt over Dalit boy's death
183.article_body: Apex child rights body NCPCR has sought strict action by the Rajasthan government against those responsible for allegedly beating a Dalit boy to death for touching a drinking water pot. Police have arrested the boy's 40-year-old teacher. NCPCR, in a letter to Jalore district magistrate, sought copies of the FIR and action taken against the accused within seven days.

184.title: 'The Dirty Picture' sequel in pipeline, won't feature Vidya Balan: Reports
184.article_body: As per reports, producer Ekta Kapoor is planning a sequel to 'The Dirty Picture', one of the biggest Bollywood blockbusters. The sequel of the film, which originally featured actress Vidya Balan as Silk Smitha, is expected to have a completely different plotline with different actors. The makers are reportedly considering Kriti Sanon and Taapsee Pannu for the movie.

185.title: Farah Khan has made me the personality I am today: Geeta Kapur
185.article_body: Choreographer Geeta Kapur, who started her career in Bollywood by joining choreographer Farah Khan's troupe at 15, said Farah has played an important role in helping her make a mark in the industry. "Different people have been crucial in making a difference at every stage of my career, but working with...Farah...has made me the personality I am today," she said.

186.title: Mob lynches vegetable vendor in Raj on suspicion of stealing tractor
186.article_body: A 45-year-old vegetable vendor in Rajasthan's Alwar, who was allegedly lynched by a mob on Monday, succumbed to his injuries while undergoing treatment in a hospital in Jaipur, police said. The deceased was lynched by over a dozen people on the suspicion of stealing a tractor. The deceased was heading home after relieving himself when the incident took place.

187.title: FIR filed in Delhi after video showed Bobby Kataria smoking in plane
187.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday registered an FIR against social media influencer Bobby Kataria for allegedly violating security and safety measures by smoking inside a purported SpiceJet plane. This comes days after a video showed Kataria lighting a cigarette and smoking inside an aircraft. FIR has been filed on the basis of a complaint by SpiceJet's Legal and Company Affairs Manager.

188.title: Port won't be used for military goals: SL Prez amid Indian concerns on China 'spy' ship
188.article_body: Amid India's concerns over a Chinese 'spy' ship in Sri Lanka's Hambantota port, Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said, "We don't want Hambantota to be used for military purposes." In an interview two days before the ship docked, Wickremesinghe added, "The present ship (China's Yuan Wang 5) didn't come under [military category]. [It] came under the category of a research ship."

189.title: Expectations from him are very high: Anjum on why Pant faces criticism
189.article_body: Commenting on why Rishabh Pant faces criticism when he doesn't perform, ex-India Women captain Anjum Chopra said it's because the India wicketkeeper-batter is constantly coming up with match-winning performances and expectations from him are very high. "He has set a benchmark for himself since his debut in international cricket," she added. Pant made his India debut in February 2017.

190.title: China's Tencent plans to divest Meituan stake worth $24 billion: Report
190.article_body: Tencent plans to sell all or a bulk of its $24 billion stake in food delivery firm Meituan to monetise their eight-year-old investment, Reuters reported. Tencent is seeking to execute the sale within this year, if market conditions are favourable. Value of Tencent's shareholdings in companies has dropped from $201 billion in end-March 2021 to $89 billion in end-March 2022.

191.title: Suffering from complex mental health issues, want to apologise for past behaviour: Miller
191.article_body: Actor Ezra Miller has issued a statement amid several legal issues. "Having recently gone through a time of intense crisis, I now understand that I'm suffering complex mental health issues and have begun ongoing treatment," Miller said in a statement to Variety. "I want to apologise to everyone that I have alarmed and upset with my past behaviour," Miller added.

192.title: Video shows men touching feet of Bilkis Bano gangrape convicts, feeding them sweets
192.article_body: A video of the 11 men, who were sentenced to life imprisonment in Bilkis Bano gangrape case, walking free and being felicitated has surfaced. The video showed that their relatives touched their feet and offered them sweets. The men were found guilty of raping Bilkis while she was pregnant and murdering seven members of her family including her three-year-old daughter.

193.title: NIA court sends alleged ISIS member to 30-day judicial custody
193.article_body: A National Investigation Agency (NIA) court has sent an alleged active member of ISIS, Mohsin Ahmad, to judicial custody for 30 days. He was arrested by the agency on August 6 from his Delhi residence for his alleged involvement in the collection of funds for ISIS from sympathisers in India and sending it to other countries in form of cryptocurrency.

194.title: SC to hear Unnao rape survivor’s plea for transfer of case
194.article_body: Supreme Court has agreed to hear the plea filed by Unnao rape survivor seeking transfer of a criminal case from UP to Delhi. The victim claimed that a non-bailable warrant was issued against her after an FIR was filed by the father of one of the perpetrators. She added that there was a grave threat to her life in Unnao.

195.title: Man’s body made to float on tube to cross flooded river in MP by villagers
195.article_body: A man’s body was allegedly tied to floating rubber tube by some villagers in MP to cross flooded Narmada river, between Dindori and Anuppur and make it reach its village for last rites following closure of connecting road. A local administration official said they would probe the matter, after video of some people carrying the body surfaced on social media

196.title: History-sheeter shot dead outside district court in UP's Hapur
196.article_body: A history-sheeter was shot dead by unidentified assailants outside the district and sessions court in UP's Hapur, police said on Tuesday. Lakhan(35), the deceased, was brought from Haryana's Faridabad jail in connection with a case registered against him at Hapur's Dhaulana police station. Examination of CCTV footage of the incident is underway and shooters will be identified soon, police added.

197.title: Factory manufacturing fake black pepper busted in UP, 4 arrested
197.article_body: Police said a factory manufacturing fake black pepper was busted in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur and four people were arrested on Tuesday. Eight quintals of fake black pepper, 25 quintals of ingredients and chemicals were found, SP (City) Sanjay Kumar said. The factory owner said he used to sell the adulterated spices to wholesalers at the rate of ₹250 per kilogram.

198.title: Made in India defence system F-INSAS handed over to Indian Army
198.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday handed over the Future Infantry Soldier As A System (F-INSAS) to the Indian Army. With a range of 300 metres, the weapon system is the first and only Made in India weapon of the 21 series. F-INSAS soldiers are provided with elbow and knee pads, ballistic helmet, goggles, bulletproof jacket, and night vision devices.

199.title: New Zealand A to tour India in August-September, Aus A visit likely in Nov
199.article_body: New Zealand A is reportedly set to tour India in August-September for three four-day games and as many List A matches. According to a report, BCCI is also in negotiations with Cricket Australia for a tour in November. This will be India A's first assignment since their tour to South Africa prior to the national team's three-Test series in December.

200.title: What about past promises: KT Rama Rao on PM Modi's I-Day speech
200.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi set five resolves for the country during his Independence Day speech, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao asked as to what happened to his past promises. "Where is...accountability if you don't even acknowledge your own targets & subsequent failures in accomplishing the same?" KTR tweeted. He shared reports of PM talking about doubling farmers' income by 2022.

201.title: Proposed Aqua Hub in Mid Manair Dam will provide 10,000 jobs: KTR
201.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration and Urban Development (MAUD) Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday said establishing the proposed Aqua Hub in Mid Manair Dam would ensure employment for 10,000 people. "An MoU has been signed with a US-based fish organisation to set up the country's biggest Aqua Hub in...Mid Manair Dam," KTR said, adding this would be a game-changer for fisheries.

202.title: UP Cabinet approves setting up of eco-tourism development board
202.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Cabinet on Tuesday approved setting up of an eco-tourism development board to fully utilise the state's tourism potential. The board will be headed by Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath with ministers of 10 departments as its members, Tourism Minister Jaiveer Singh said. He added that the board will help the state attract domestic and international tourists.

203.title: Before aunties & uncles used to troll, now social media: Vijay Deverakonda
203.article_body: Responding to a question about social media trolls during the promotions of his upcoming film 'Liger', actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "[Trolling] is common, it's an everyday thing." He added, "Even before I became an actor, aunties and uncles used to troll about results, college, job etc...now it's social media trolling." "Be it anything, trolling is always there," Vijay said.

204.title: Got to know of convicts' release through media: Bilkis Bano's husband
204.article_body: A day after all 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for Bilkis Bano's gang-rape walked out of jail, her husband said he came to know of their release through media. "We don't know when the convicts processed their application and which ruling...state government took into consideration," Bano's husband Yakub Rasul said. The convicts were released under Gujarat government's remission policy.

205.title: Family finds human remains in suitcases bought at an auction in New Zealand
205.article_body: A family in New Zealand's Auckland found human remains in suitcases they purchased at a storage unit auction, police said. The family called the police after finding the remains that they unknowingly brought home. Reports said that police could be dealing with remains from multiple human bodies and a homicide investigation has been launched.

206.title: Started happening a lot, it's unfair: Arjun on people boycotting B'wood films
206.article_body: While talking about people boycotting Bollywood films, actor Arjun Kapoor said that it has started happening a lot now and that it is unfair. "I think we made a mistake by being silent...that was our decency but people have started taking advantage of that...I guess we tolerated it a lot and now people have made this a habit," he added.

207.title: Doubtful Dalit boy beaten for touching water pot of upper-caste people: Raj MLA
207.article_body: BJP MLA from Rajasthan's Jalore Jogeshwar Garg has said that he talked to villagers and there is "doubt" that the nine-year-old Dalit boy, who died after being allegedly beaten by his teacher, was thrashed because he touched a water pot used by upper-caste people. He, however, added that there's "no doubt that the boy was beaten up by the teacher".

208.title: We're playing nice cricket, but haven't given ours a name: Boucher on 'Bazball'
208.article_body: Referring to England's attacking style of cricket being called 'Bazball', South Africa head coach Mark Boucher said, "We've not given ours a name. [But] we believe we've been playing a nice brand of cricket." Boucher added, "We want to play aggressive cricket but you have to be smart." South Africa's three-match Test series against England will begin on August 17.

209.title: US stoking tensions in Asia with Pelosi's visit, AUKUS: Putin
209.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin described US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit as a ''thoroughly planned provocation'' and accused the US of stoking tensions in Asia. While speaking at a Moscow security conference, Putin said AUKUS is evidence of the West's attempts to build a NATO-style bloc in the Asia-Pacific region. Putin called AUKUS an aggressive military-political alliance.

210.title: Declared Arjun Reddy a blockbuster when I released it, felt it was one: Vijay
210.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said that he declares some of his movies blockbusters even before he starts promoting them. He said that his upcoming movie 'Liger' is one of them. He also said that he had also declared 'Arjun Reddy' a blockbuster when he released the movie but that he also felt pressure of saying it out loud.

211.title: Estonia removes Soviet-era tank monument amid Ukraine-Russia war
211.article_body: Amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war, Estonia has said it'll remove a Soviet-era tank monument from public space in Narva, a town with large Russian-speaking population. "No one wants to see our militant and hostile neighbour foment tensions in our home," Estonia's PM Kaja Kallas said, adding, "We'll not afford Russia the opportunity to use the past to disturb...peace in Estonia."

212.title: When I travel, I carry books for competitive exams: CWG medallist Sreeshankar
212.article_body: India's first male athlete to win a silver in the long jump at CWG, Murali Sreeshankar has revealed that he carries "a lot of books" when he travels as he's preparing for competitive exams. He added, "I hope some organisation offers me a job as it's very important to have job security." Sreeshankar bagged silver at the 2022 CWG.

213.title: French forces stationed in Mali since 2013 leave the country
213.article_body: French forces battling Islamist militants in Mali since 2013 left the country on Monday, France's Defence Ministry informed. The decision to withdraw troops was taken by France in February over deteriorating relations with Mali. France and its military allies have said that Niger will become the new hub of operations for their forces battling Islamist militants in the Sahel region.

214.title: Shah Rukh Khan-owned Abu Dhabi Knight Riders announce their 1st ever squad
214.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan-owned Abu Dhabi Knight Riders (ADKR) on Tuesday announced their first-ever squad for the UAE's inaugural International League T20 season. Sunil Narine and Andre Russell, who represent KKR in IPL, have been included in the ADKR squad. The squad also includes Jonny Bairstow, Lahiru Kumara, Charith Asalanka, Colin Ingram and Ravi Rampaul, among others.

215.title: Kevin O'Brien, who hit the fastest-ever World Cup ton, retires from international cricket
215.article_body: Ireland all-rounder Kevin O'Brien on Tuesday announced his retirement from international cricket aged 38. O'Brien, who holds the record for the fastest-ever ODI World Cup hundred, said, "I had hoped to finish...career at...T20 World Cup in Australia but having not been picked for the Irish squad since last year's World Cup...I feel the selectors and management are looking elsewhere."

216.title: ICC reveals first-ever women's Future Tours Program
216.article_body: The ICC on Tuesday announced the first-ever women's Future Tours Program (FTP). The FTP includes the international obligations for all the sides until the end of April in 2025, leading up to the women's World Cup in India. There will be 301 international women's matches played during the next period, featuring seven Test matches, 135 ODIs and 159 T20Is.

217.title: Explosions hit Crimean village, Russian representative says 2 injured
217.article_body: An ammunition depot in Russia-annexed region of Crimea witnessed explosions on Tuesday. A Russian representative in the region said two people were wounded, railway traffic had been halted and about 2,000 people in a nearby village were evacuated. "Crimea occupied by Russians is about warehouse explosions and high risk of death for invaders and thieves," Ukrainian presidential advisor tweeted.

218.title: Some of our leaders instigating party workers: Rajasthan CM Gehlot
218.article_body: In a veiled attack on Rajasthan's former Deputy CM Sachin Pilot, Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said some party leaders are instigating workers by telling them that they are not being treated with respect. "Have you ever honoured and respected...workers? Do you even know what honour and respect [are]?" Gehlot said. His remarks came while addressing a programme at Shaheed Memorial.

219.title: No money is lost: 'Laal Singh...' makers on reports of distributors demanding compensation
219.article_body: Ajit Andhare, CEO of Viacom 18 Studios, has denied reports of some distributors demanding compensation for the performance of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "There are no external distributors...and no money is lost in...first place. Film is still running in theatres both in India and internationally. This is baseless speculation," he told ETimes. The film has earned ₹45.83 crore so far.

220.title: Very unfortunate that FIFA has banned Indian football: Bhaichung Bhutia
220.article_body: Reacting to FIFA suspending All India Football Federation (AIFF), former India captain Bhaichung Bhutia said, "Very unfortunate that FIFA has banned Indian football...I feel it's a very harsh decision of FIFA to ban Indian football." He added, "But at the same time I feel it's a great opportunity for us to get our system right."

221.title: I rank 'RRR' below 'Makkhi' and a lot of other films: Anurag Kashyap
221.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said he'd rank SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' below 'Baahubali', 'Makkhi' as well as a "lot of other" films. "When you're building a mythology...it's not...sticking," added Kashyap. "I didn't enjoy 'RRR' as much as 'Pushpa'," he stated. However, Kashyap believes 'RRR' is among films that can be India's entry for Oscars, adding he hopes 'The Kashmir Files' isn't picked.

222.title: Terrorists responsible won't be spared: J&K LG on killing of Kashmiri Pandit
222.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Tuesday condemned the incident where a Kashmiri Pandit was killed and his brother got injured in Shopian after terrorists fired upon civilians. "The attack deserves the strongest condemnation from everyone. Terrorists responsible for the barbaric act will not be spared," the Office of LG J&K tweeted. "Pained beyond words on despicable terror attack," tweet read.

223.title: California-based startup Fictiv opens its first office in India in Pune
223.article_body: California-based startup Fictiv is opening its first office in India in Pune. Fictiv helps other startups create products with an easy-to-use platform as it supports a network of manufacturing partners and innovators around the world. Fictiv started hiring last year for Pune and currently has 30 employees in the city, and the company said future hires are in the pipeline.

224.title: Asteroids may have brought water to Earth billions of years ago: Study
224.article_body: Asteroids might have brought water to the Earth billions of years ago, a Japanese study that analysed rare samples brought back to the planet from the asteroid Ryugu stated. "Volatile and organic-rich C-type asteroids may have been one of the main sources of Earth's water," the study stated. "The delivery of volatiles to...Earth is still a subject of...debate," it added.

225.title: Pune's CGST & Customs chief hoists National Flag to mark 76th I-Day
225.article_body: The CGST & Customs, Pune Zone tweeted on Monday that the agency's Chief Commissioner SM Tata hoisted the National Flag amid celebrations to mark India's 76th Independence Day. It added that Tata also felicitated the specially-abled employees of Terrasinne, which is Pune's first conscious dining restaurant and from where the refreshments for the event were obtained.

226.title: Told composers 'Don't release Sidhu's songs' as people would've misused: Gippy
226.article_body: Punjabi singer Gippy Grewal revealed the reason why he told music composers to not release Sidhu Moosewala's unfinished or finished songs after the latter's death. "People would've misused them," he said. He added that Sidhu's songs are only property his parents are left with. "Even after his death, a couple of his songs got released...we don't know how," he stated.

227.title: Air India to use Meta's Workplace for communication with employees
227.article_body: To communicate with its 11,000 plus employees, Air India will use Meta's digital platform called Workplace. This will give the "employees a platform that promotes more open communication and information sharing within and across all levels of the organisation", the airline said. It will help Air India's employees get regular and real-time updates on the airline's operations and future plans.

228.title: 1,900 Signal users' phone numbers exposed in Twilio hack
228.article_body: End-to-end encrypted messaging platform Signal has said that phone numbers and SMS verification codes of 1,900 users may have been revealed in a phishing attack on Twilio Inc, earlier this month. However, it said message history, profile information and contact lists were not revealed. Twilio disclosed the phishing attack on August 7 through a blogpost.

229.title: Wild elephant dies due to mouth injury near TN-Kerala border area
229.article_body: An ailing wild elephant, who was suffering from a mouth injury for the last four days, died on Tuesday afternoon, as per ANI report. The elephant used to live in Attappadi and Anaikatti areas at the Tamil Nadu-Kerala border. As per the report, the elephant was not eating for the past several days due to injury.

230.title: TN CM Stalin announces 3% hike in DA for govt employees, pensioners
230.article_body: While addressing the public on Independence Day, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin announced a 3% hike in the dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees and pensioners. This would benefit over 16 lakh people and is expected to cost the exchequer around ₹1947.6 crore. Freedom fighters' monthly pension has been increased from ₹18,000 to ₹20,000 from August 15, Stalin added.

231.title: Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' earns ₹46.25 crore in 5 days
231.article_body: Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' earned ₹8.50 crore on Monday, bringing the domestic box office collection to ₹46.25 crore in five days. The film collected ₹9 crore and ₹10 crore on Saturday and Sunday, respectively. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' also features Mona Singh and Naga Chaitanya. It is an official remake of Tom Hanks-starrer 'Forrest Gump'.

232.title: Another example of PM Modi govt's failure: Owaisi on killing of Kashmiri Pandit
232.article_body: Condemning the incident where a Kashmiri Pandit was killed and his brother got injured in Shopian after terrorists fired upon civilians, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "This is another example of the failure of the [PM] Modi government." "The responsibility for the failure to safeguard the lives of Kashmiri Pandits in J&K lies on BJP and its government," he added.

233.title: There's no need to use nuclear weapons in Ukraine: Russia amid speculations
233.article_body: Russian defence minister Sergei Shoigu has said that there is "no need" to use nuclear weapons in Ukraine. He further described media speculation that Russia might deploy nuclear or chemical weapons against Ukraine as "absolute lies". "The main purpose of Russian nuclear weapons is to deter a nuclear attack," Shoigu stated.

234.title: Ratan Tata invests in startup founded by his business assistant for senior citizens
234.article_body: Ratan Tata has invested an undisclosed amount into Goodfellows, a startup founded by Shantanu Naidu which offers companionship as a service to senior citizens. Goodfellows hires graduates with emotional intelligence to work with senior citizens and has been working with 20 elders for the last six months in its beta phase. Notably, Naidu is the General Manager in Tata's office.

235.title: I urge PM Modi to interfere: Ex-player Barua on FIFA suspending AIFF
235.article_body: Former Indian footballer Anadi Barua has "urged" PM Narendra Modi and Sports Minister Anurag Thakur to "interfere", after FIFA suspended the All India Football Federation (AIFF). "AIFF needs many changes...If this is not done soon...it will be more harmful," added Barua. Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal had earlier stated that the "worst Olympic federation" is "better" than the AIFF.

236.title: Over 7.9 million enrolled under Baal Aadhaar from April to July: Govt
236.article_body: Over 7.9 million children, aged up to five, were enrolled under the Baal Aadhaar initiative from April to July, Electronics and Information Technology Ministry said. As many as 26.4 million children in the zero-five age group had been enrolled by the end of March, it added. "Baal Aadhaar works as a digital photo identity for children," the Ministry further said.

237.title: BMC to demolish over 100-yr-old dilapidated building in south Mumbai
237.article_body: Bombay HC has permitted Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation to demolish an over 100-year-old dilapidated building in south Mumbai and has directed its occupants to vacate the premises. The HN Petit Widows Home, which has five floors, was used to provide hostel facilities to widows. Due to the building's poor condition, the widows residing there were moved to another hostel in 2019.

238.title: Bengal dengue cases up 7 times till August 1st week as compared to last year
238.article_body: Dengue cases shot up nearly seven times in West Bengal till August first week as compared to last year. According to state Health Department, around 450 dengue cases were detected till first week of August in 2021. However, this year, the number has shot up to 3,104 during same period. The Health Department has submitted a report to chief secretary.

239.title: China announces new military drills as US delegation visits Taiwan
239.article_body: China announced more military drills on Tuesday after a five-member US delegation met Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen. Beijing has not revealed where and when the drills would be conducted. On Monday, Tsai said that her administration was working with allies to ensure stability in the Taiwan Strait, however, China accused US of trying to change the ''One China'' policy.

240.title: Gunmen kill 2 policemen escorting polio workers in Pakistan
240.article_body: Motorcycle-borne gunmen on Tuesday opened fire on police escorting a team of polio workers in northwestern Pakistan, killing two policemen, authorities said. The assailants fled the scene and no one group has claimed responsibility for the attack in Gomal town so far. The attack took place on the second day of Pakistan's latest anti-polio campaign in the province.

241.title: Delhi HC reserves order on PIL for Satyendar Jain’s disqualification
241.article_body: The Delhi HC reserved the order on a PIL seeking direction to disqualify Satyendar Jain from the Assembly and the Cabinet due to his 'memory loss' issue. The plea said that the government is violating Constitution's clause that specifies that a person shall be disqualified if he/she is of unsound mind and declared the same by a court.

242.title: Hyderabad man hangs himself on video call with wife
242.article_body: A 33-year-old Hyderabad-based man, Sai Karthik Goud died by suicide after an argument with his wife. The incident happened after Goud asked his wife to accompany him to his parents' house to celebrate Bonalu but she refused. Irritated over their argument, Goud put a noose around his neck and made a video call to his wife and hanged himself.

243.title: Menswear has changed drastically: Kunal Rawal on 15 yrs in fashion
243.article_body: Designer Kunal Rawal, who recently completed 15 years in the fashion industry, said menswear has "changed so drastically" and for the better. He said menswear is "far more democratic" now. "In the last few years, India has been more progressive and you have the strongest correlations. So, that is a big part of inspiration," he added.

244.title: I will try to 'outdo' Rishabh Pant in the boundary count: Ryan Burl
244.article_body: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl, who recently smashed 34 runs in an over, in the third T20I against Bangladesh, said he will try and "outdo" Rishabh Pant in the boundary count during the ODI series against India. "I...see myself in Pant," added Burl. Burl earlier stated he was trying to "emulate" Yuvraj Singh in the over where he smashed 34 runs.

245.title: Maybe Ponting suffered jet lag: Salman Butt on 'Surya is like ABD' comment
245.article_body: Reacting to Ricky Ponting's comment that India batter Suryakumar Yadav is like former South Africa batter AB de Villiers, ex-Pakistan captain Salman Butt said that the comparison was a "bit too much". Butt added, "Suryakumar is yet to play in big tournaments...[and] the fact is nobody has ever played cricket like De Villiers....maybe Ponting suffered a jet lag."

246.title: Scientists develop smart contact lenses that can diagnose cancer
246.article_body: Scientists from the Terasaki Institute for Biomedical Innovation have developed smart contact lenses that can potentially screen and diagnose cancer. This lens can capture and detect exosomes, nanometer-sized vesicles found in tears, which have potential for being diagnostic cancer biomarkers. This may serve as an inexpensive screening programme for multiple types of cancer, researchers said.

247.title: 2 e-scooters catch fire, explode in Hyderabad
247.article_body: Two electric scooters caught fire as their batteries exploded while charging in Hyderabad on Monday. The owner of the vehicles T Haribabu said that he had recently purchased both electric scooters and he had put them on charge in front of his house. An hour later, he heard a loud explosion and saw both the two-wheelers engulfed in flames.

248.title: India's WPI inflation eases to 13.93% in July: Ministry data
248.article_body: India’s wholesale inflation declined to 13.93% in July, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry data showed. The Wholesale Price Index (WPI) based inflation has been in the double-digit for 16 months now. The rise in prices of mineral oils, food articles, crude petroleum and natural gas and electricity, among other things, contributed to inflation in July 2022, the ministry said.

249.title: 'Laal Singh…' is a piece of art, Aamir is pure genius: Neha Dhupia
249.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia has called Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha" a "piece of art". Calling Aamir a "pure genius", Neha requested fans to not fall for the boycott trend and make time to watch the film. She said the film is like magic that "transports you into a world where only goodness exists, truly and purely because its only heart".

250.title: 5 more ships depart from Ukraine under grain export deal: Turkey
250.article_body: Five more ships with corn and wheat have departed from Ukraine's Black Sea ports under the grain export deal signed last month, Turkey's Defence Ministry said on Tuesday. Another four ships headed for Ukraine were to undergo inspection on Tuesday by the joint co-ordination centre set up under the deal in Istanbul, the ministry added.

251.title: Pune Metro to extend till Dapodi, Deccan Gymkhana after I-Day trial run
251.article_body: After successful trial runs on August 15, Pune Metro is all set to expand from Garware College to Deccan Gymkhana and from Phugewadi to Dapodi, officials said. "The successful trial run on these routes have paved the way for extending the service till Shivajinagar on Reach 1 and Civil Court on Reach 2," public relations officer of Pune Metro said.

252.title: What is China's 'Yuan Wang 5' ship, being closely watched by India as it reaches SL?
252.article_body: India had earlier said it's 'monitoring the movements' of the Chinese surveillance ship 'Yuan Wang 5' which has now arrived in Sri Lanka. China uses the Yuan Wang class ships to track satellite and ballistic missile launches. It's in Lanka to do satellite control and research tracking of Chinese satellites. Reports suggested south Indian ports could be surveilled by it.

253.title: Kerala man launches 30,000-km solo bicycle ride to London on I-Day
253.article_body: On the occasion of Independence Day on Monday, a 34-year-old man from Kerala embarked on a solo cycle expedition from Thiruvananthapuram to spread the message of peace among countries. As per the itinerary, Faiz Ashraf Ali will cover 30,000 km and 35 countries on a bicycle and reach his destination, London, in 450 days. He'll travel from Mumbai-Oman by air.

254.title: Hotter summers fuelled by climate change may increase skin cancers: Experts
254.article_body: Higher summer temperatures caused due to climate change may lead to more cases of melanoma, one of the most serious types of skin cancer, say experts. "Melanoma is caused essentially by sunburn, and this weather is so extreme that I am concerned that sunburns will increase and...so will the incidence of melanoma," Julia Newton-Bishop, a clinician scientist, said.

255.title: Housing prices rise by 4% in April-June quarter in Bengaluru: Report
255.article_body: Housing prices in Bengaluru increased by 4% to ₹7,848 per square foot in April to June quarter as compared to last year, a report by CREDAI, Colliers and Liases Foras said. Bengaluru also saw the highest dip in unsold inventory of 21% on year-on-year basis, the report said, adding that prices rose by 4% in the city's outer south region.

256.title: Tragic loss of precious lives: Prez condoles death of ITBP personnel in J&K
256.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday condoled the death of seven ITBP personnel who died after their bus fell into a river bed in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. "The tragic loss of precious lives of ITBP personnel in the unfortunate accident at Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir fills me with sadness. My heartfelt condolences for the bereaved families," the Rashtrapati Bhavan tweeted.

257.title: It's ludicrous to suggest Rushdie's responsible for attack on him: UK
257.article_body: The UK said it's "ludicrous" to suggest that author Salman Rushdie was responsible for the attack on him. This comes after Iran suggested that Rushdie had "exposed himself to...anger and rage of the people" by insulting Islamic sanctities and "crossing the red lines of over 1.5 billion Muslims". Rushdie was stabbed by a 24-year-old man in New York on Friday.

258.title: He made faces, talked in derogatory tone: Taapsee on argument with photographer
258.article_body: While talking about her recent video where she can be seen in an argument with a photographer at an event, actress Taapsee Pannu said that the photographer "kept making faces" at her and spoke to her in a derogatory tone. "I did not want to retaliate. I folded my hands and accepted whatever he had to say," she added.

259.title: Supreme Court to hear AIFF case tomorrow after FIFA's suspension
259.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday will hear the case related to the All India Football Federation (AIFF) after the Central government sought an urgent hearing in the matter following FIFA's suspension of the Indian football body. Solicitor General of India Tushar Mehta requested the urgent hearing, stating that "some development" has taken place in relation to AIFF.

260.title: Pakistan wants bloodbath in Kashmir: J&K BJP chief on killing of Kashmiri Pandit
260.article_body: J&K BJP chief Ravinder Raina on Tuesday condemned the incident where a Kashmiri Pandit was killed in Shopian after terrorists fired upon civilians. "Pakistan wants to turn Kashmir into graveyard...[It] wants a bloodbath in Kashmir...we won't allow it to fulfil its nefarious designs," Raina said. "Those involved in targeting Kashmiri Pandits...will be taken to task," he stated.

261.title: Online game chat helps Delhi Police reunite minor girl with family
261.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was reunited with her family by the Delhi Police after examining a conversation that took place in the online game, 'Free Fire'. The game's chat helped the police contact her friend, who informed the police that she had contacted him through an auto-rickshaw driver's phone, following which she was found at Gurudwara Bangla Sahib.

262.title: Woman poisons 3 daughters after spat with husband in UP
262.article_body: A woman poisoned her three daughters following a spat with her husband over a domestic issue in UP's Ghazipur. Two daughters died on the spot, while the third succumbed during treatment in the hospital, reports said. The police have registered a case for murder against the woman, who is in police custody, according to reports.

263.title: IIT Bombay reacts after being criticised for photoshopping Tricolour on campus in FB pic
263.article_body: IIT Bombay has reacted after being criticised for photoshopping the Tricolour on campus in a Facebook picture. "The picture of IIT Bombay Main Building with a flag was a depiction to commemorate Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav and not an actual photo. Our goal was to create the spirit of the Mahotsav. We regret the confusion this may've caused," it said.

264.title: Man shot, then stabbed to death during gambling session in Gujarat
264.article_body: A man died after he was shot in the stomach and later stabbed in the chest, neck and shoulder while he was gambling in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Sunday afternoon. Police found playing cards at the murder scene and suspect the crime to be a fallout of some dispute. The deceased reportedly had an enmity with a local politician too.

265.title: Delhi man threatens mother-in-law at gunpoint, fires into wall; held
265.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested on Monday after he allegedly fired into the wall of his mother-in-law's house while threatening her at gunpoint when he went there to take his estranged wife home, the police said. An officer said that the accused had apparently fired in his mother-in-law's general direction. No one was injured in the incident, the police added.

266.title: Iran submits written response in 2015 nuclear deal talks: Reports
266.article_body: Iran has submitted a written response in the ongoing talks to restore 2015 nuclear deal. Tehran would not take the proposal mediated by the European Union, Iran's state-run news agency IRNA reported. "The differences are on three issues...the US...expressed...verbal flexibility in two cases, but it should be included in the text," the IRNA report said.

267.title: Karnataka minister says 'govt not functioning, somehow managing'; CM Bommai responds
267.article_body: Karnataka Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister JC Madhuswamy has purportedly claimed that the state government is not functioning and added that the officials are somehow managing. Commenting on Madhuswamy's remarks, CM Basavaraj Bommai said the minister's statements were made in a "different context". Madhuswamy's remarks were revealed in an audio leak.

268.title: SS Rajamouli: Actor Manav Gohil on the person he last fantasised about
268.article_body: Actor Manav Gohil, who was seen in 'Baaghi 3' and 'Super 30', said in an interview that the last person he "fantasised" about was 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli. Manav added Brad Pitt is the same-sex actor he's crushing on, terming actress Raveena Tandon as his celebrity crush. Talking about the place where he first kissed someone, Manav named Sweden.

269.title: Aditya shouldn't sit in cave, dictate filmmakers: Anurag on Shamshera failing
269.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap opened up about 'Shamshera' failing at the box office and said that Aditya Chopra needs to empower filmmakers and not dictate them or control their casting. "You've one person sitting in a cave, who doesn't know the world outside, dictating how everybody should be making their films...telling them what to do," he said speaking about Aditya.

270.title: 2-time champion Murray beats Wawrinka to enter second round at Cincinnati Open
270.article_body: Ex-world number one Andy Murray defeated three-time Grand Slam champion Stanislas Wawrinka 7-6(7-3), 5-7, 7-5 in the first round at Cincinnati Open on Monday. The two-time champion will now face ninth-seeded Cameron Norrie, who beat Dane Holger Rune 7-6(7-5), 4-6, 6-4, in the second round. Unseeded Frances Tiafoe defeated 12th-seeded Matteo Berrettini 7-6(7-3), 4-6, 7-6(7-5) to reach second round.

271.title: You don't know what it's like to be lonely: Tata on investing in startup for senior citizens
271.article_body: Ratan Tata on Tuesday announced an undisclosed investment in GoodFellows, a startup founded by Shantanu Naidu that offers companionship to senior citizens as a service. "You don't know what it's like to be lonely until you spend time alone wishing for companionship," Tata said at the launch. He added no one cares about getting old until they actually get old.

272.title: Our domestic level is not that great in women's cricket: Harmanpreet Kaur
272.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur has said that the domestic level in women's cricket is not that great in India and the Women's IPL might help prepare girls for the international level. "[In] women's IPL...our domestic players will also get a chance to play with overseas players...they'll not feel that pressure...when they play international games," explained Kaur.

273.title: Part of body of boy who went missing after Kullu flash floods recovered
273.article_body: A part of the body of a boy who had gone missing after flash floods in Kullu has been recovered, news agency ANI reported. Another body was also found. Sub Divisional Magistrate of Manali said that around 100 people, including NDRF, police, fire brigade, team of administration and local volunteers deployed for rescue operations, were present on spot.

274.title: 5 men, minor boy repeatedly rape 17-year-old girl in Maha, arrested
274.article_body: Five men were arrested and a minor boy was detained for allegedly raping a 17-year-old girl repeatedly in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, police said on Tuesday. The victim's parents approached the police on Saturday, following which the five accused were arrested, a senior police official said. The accused were produced before a court, which sent them to police custody till August 17.

275.title: Class 12 girl returning from I-Day celebrations run over by bus in Chennai
275.article_body: A Class 12 girl, who was returning from Independence Day celebrations at school, was killed after being hit by a Metropolitan Transport Corporation (MTC) bus in Chennai on Monday. A CCTV footage shows the deceased student and her friend riding their bicycles on Rajendra Prasad Road when the bus passes by. The bus driver had surrendered on Monday, police said.

276.title: Aus city votes to remove 132-yr-old statue of grave-robbing politician
276.article_body: Australian city of Hobart in Tasmania voted to remove a 132-year-old statue commemorating a politician who stole the skull of an Aboriginal man from a local morgue and replaced it with that of another corpse. The removal of William Crowther's statue is a "part of the process of truth-telling" about the history of Tasmania, Hobart's Lord Mayor Anna Reynolds said.

277.title: Oscars apologises to actress Sacheen 50 years after she was booed off the stage
277.article_body: The Academy Awards has apologised to Native American actress Sacheen Littlefeather nearly 50 years after she was booed off the stage. At the 1973 Academy Awards, Littlefeather was heckled as she explained why Marlon Brando had rejected best actor award for 'The Godfather' on his behalf. Littlefeather later said actor John Wayne had to be restrained from physically assaulting her.

278.title: Dubai Crown Prince goes unnoticed while travelling in London metro, shares pics
278.article_body: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum, the Crown Prince of Dubai, travelled in the London metro (Tube) and went unrecognised. Sheikh Hamdan shared pictures of himself standing on a crowded train with his fellow commuters seemingly unaware of his identity. The pictures got over 10,000 comments, one of which said, "These poor people have no idea with whom they're travelling."

279.title: 6 Shrikant Tyagi's associates jailed for creating ruckus, granted bail
279.article_body: Six associates of politician Shrikant Tyagi, jailed for entering and creating ruckus at Grand Omaxe society in Noida, Sector 93 have been granted bail today. These associates had barged into the society and demanded the address of the woman who confronted Tyagi. Self-proclaimed politician Tyagi was arrested by Noida Police for molesting and abusing a woman.

280.title: Prem Watsa-backed Digit Insurance files draft papers for IPO
280.article_body: Bengaluru-based startup Go Digit General Insurance has filed draft papers with the SEBI for an initial public offering (IPO). The startup, backed by billionaire Prem Watsa's Fairfax Financial Holdings, will sell 10.9 crore shares in its offer-for-sale portion and issue new stock worth ₹1,250 crore through IPO. The company may also sell shares worth ₹250 crore in a pre-IPO placement.

281.title: Ancient watermelons tasted bitter and could kill you: Study
281.article_body: A study has found that watermelons cultivated around 6,000 years ago tasted bitter and could have also killed a person on consumption. Our ancestors removed the red flesh and only consumed the seeds of the fruit. Scientists believe the pungent taste of watermelon must have changed after domestication, as fruits tend to lose some of their traits during the process.

282.title: 4 people returning from Jagannath Temple rescued from floods in Odisha
282.article_body: Four pilgrims returning from Jagannath Temple were rescued after their car was stuck in floodwaters in Odisha's Cuttack district on Monday night. Notably, incessant rainfall for past few days led to flooding in Mahanadi river with water entering low-lying areas in Jajpur and Dasarathpur blocks. Earlier, eight gates of Hirakud dam were closed to prevent any large-scale flooding downstream.

283.title: Crypto lender Celsius' actual debt stands at $2.85 billion: Report
283.article_body: Filings from a new bankruptcy report have shown that crypto lender Celsius Network's actual debt stands at $2.85 billion, against their bankruptcy claims of a $1.2 billion deficit, Cointelegraph reported. The report states that Celsius has around $4.3 billion in assets against $5.5 billion in liabilities. Celsius had filed for bankruptcy after collapse in value of Terra USD.

284.title: DFM Foods shares hit 20% upper circuit on delisting proposal
284.article_body: The shares of DFM Foods Limited hit the 20% upper circuit on Tuesday for the second consecutive session to ₹304 apiece at opening trade on the BSE. On Monday, private equity firm Advent International, a majority stakeholder in DFM Foods via its subsidiary AI Global Investments, announced the proposal to delist the snack maker from the stock exchanges.

285.title: Amitabh Bachchan asks question about boAt on KBC 14, Co-founder Aman Gupta reacts
285.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Amitabh Bachchan asked a question about electronics brand boAt. Co-founder Aman Gupta, sharing a screenshot of the question, wrote on Instagram, "Aaj khush toh boAt hoge tum, Hainnn. Proud to see entrepreneurs and startups as General Knowledge questions." "Superb," Aman's Shark Tank India fellow judge Ashneer Grover commented on the post.

286.title: Amul, Mother Dairy to raise milk prices by ₹2 per litre from tomorrow
286.article_body: Amul has announced that it's increasing its milk prices by ₹2 per litre from August 17. The prices of Amul milk will be hiked in areas like Gujarat's Ahmedabad and Saurashtra, Delhi NCR, West Bengal, Mumbai and other markets where Amul markets fresh milk. Mother Dairy also announced that it is increasing milk prices by ₹2 per litre from tomorrow.

287.title: Ready to work with Centre to improve healthcare, don't call it freebie: Kejriwal
287.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday appealed to the Centre to not term free education and health care facilities as "freebies". "We are ready to work with the Centre to improve healthcare services and education…I offer central government to use our services," CM Kejriwal added. "All state governments can work together," CM Kejriwal said.

288.title: Grand Alliance is stronger with Nitish Kumar: Manoj Jha
288.article_body: Backing the RJD-JD(U) alliance in Bihar, MP Manoj Jha claimed that the “map of 2024 elections is clear” up to a great extent. “This entire Mahagathbandhan is stronger with Nitish Kumar coming into the alliance. So, the map of 2024 is clear up to a great extent,” said Jha. JD(U), earlier this month, formed a new government with RJD.

289.title: Manipur to add police outposts along Myanmar border to check infiltration
289.article_body: The Manipur government has approved a proposal to set up 34 new police outposts along the India-Myanmar border to check illegal immigration from Myanmar, said CM N Biren Singh. The outposts will come up between Jessami and Behiang villages. Singh was addressing an event at 1st Manipur Rifles Parade Ground in Imphal on the occasion of 76th Independence Day.

290.title: Kashmiri Pandit killed, his brother injured as terrorists fire on civilians in J&K
290.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit was killed and his brother injured after terrorists fired upon civilians in an apple orchard in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, police said. The deceased was identified as Sunil Kumar Bhat and his brother as Pintu Kumar. The injured person was shifted to a hospital and the area has been cordoned off, police added.

291.title: Want to see how Rue looks in sobriety journey: Zendaya on 'Euphoria'
291.article_body: Speaking about season 3 of her show 'Euphoria', actress Zendaya said, "I want to see what Rue (her character in the show) looks like in her sobriety journey, how chaotic that might look." She further added that it will be "exciting" to explore the characters out of high school. The release date of season 3 is not yet known.

292.title: Ukraine demands new sanctions on Russia after fresh shelling near nuclear plant
292.article_body: Ukraine has called for new sanctions on Russia and highlighted risks of a catastrophe at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant after fresh shelling. "If through Russia's actions a catastrophe occurs, the consequences could hit those who for the moment are silent," Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. Ukrainian and Russian officials accused each other of carrying out attacks near Zaporizhzhia.

293.title: Apollo Tyres' shares jump after Q1 net profit surges by 49%
293.article_body: The shares of Apollo Tyres are trading high after the company reported a 49% surge in its consolidated net profit at ₹190.68 crore for the quarter ended June. Its revenue from operations stood at ₹5,942 crore, a 29.6% jump from ₹4,584.47 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. At 1:50 pm, its shares were up 5.80% on the NSE.

294.title: Ex-Aus PM Morrison defends taking secret ministerial roles during COVID
294.article_body: Former Australian PM Scott Morrison defended his secret portfolio appointments between March 2020 and May 2021, saying they were "safeguards" and "the right decision" during the COVID-19 pandemic. Morrison added he'd have made the appointments public had he needed to use the powers involved. "Sometimes we forget what was happening two years ago...It was an...unprecedented time," he further said.

295.title: Amul to raise milk prices by ₹2 per litre in some areas from tomorrow
295.article_body: Amul on Tuesday announced that it's increasing the price for its milk across several regions in India by ₹2 per litre. The revised prices of milk will be effective from August 17, the company said. The prices will be hiked in areas like Gujarat's Ahmedabad and Saurashtra, Delhi NCR, West Bengal, Mumbai and other markets where Amul markets fresh milk.

296.title: COVID-style control room set up to tackle lumpy skin disease in Udaipur
296.article_body: Udaipur district administration has set up a COVID-19-like control room to tackle the lumpy skin disease in cattle. "The control room has been established at the district level, and at the block level we have created a rapid response team so that they can deal with suspected cases at the earliest," Joint Director, animal husbandry, said.

297.title: Portfolios allocated in Bihar; CM Nitish keeps Home, Deputy CM Tejashwi gets Health
297.article_body: As many as 31 leaders were inducted into Bihar's new Cabinet under CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday. CM Nitish has kept the Home Ministry, while Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has been appointed the Health Minister. RJD's Tej Pratap Yadav has been appointed the Minister of Environment, Forest and Climate Change. Vijay Kumar Choudhary has been made the Finance Minister.

298.title: Rajinikanth's daughter pens a note after actor completes 47 yrs in industry
298.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth's daughter penned a note on Twitter after the actor completed 47 years in the industry. While wishing Twitter users on Independence Day, Aishwaryaa wrote, "47 years of Rajinism...sheer hard work, grit and dedication!" She further said that she is proud to be his daughter. Rajinikanth made his acting debut in the 1975 film 'Apoorva Raagangal'.

299.title: As women, we face the issue every day: Huma Qureshi on body shaming
299.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi opened up about addressing the issue of body shaming in her film 'Double XL'. "As women, we face [the issue] every...day...Body shaming erodes somebody's confidence," she added. Huma said they, as actors, aim to create awareness regarding body shaming through the film. "We wanted to make an entertaining film...bring about a change in people's mindset," she concluded.

300.title: JP Nadda likely to meet with BJP Bihar core panel in Delhi: Reports
300.article_body: After BJP-JD(U) alliance broke up, BJP President JP Nadda is likely to hold a meeting with the party's Bihar core committee today in Delhi, reports said. He is likely to discuss the political upheaval and chalk out a strategy. Mahagathbandhan has the support of 164 members in the Assembly and also has the backing of four Hindustani Awam Morcha MLAs.

301.title: People don't want such a CM: BJP on KCR skipping Guv's 'At Home' function
301.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy criticised K Chandrashekar Rao for not attending Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan's 'At Home' function at Raj Bhavan on the occasion of Independence Day. "TRS is running a government of corruption-dictatorship for eight years. CM doesn't meet people and stays in a farmhouse 15 days every month. People don't want such a CM," Reddy said.

302.title: Congress criticises CM Mamata for omitting Nehru's picture
302.article_body: West Bengal Congress has criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for leaving former PM Jawaharlal Nehru out of her Twitter display picture, featuring prominent freedom fighters. Congress retweeted a post of Nehru's speech ‘Tryst with Destiny’ shared by a user. “History lesson for Mamata from a kid. Because they purposefully omitted Nehru from their DP,” said Congress.

303.title: Odisha govt closes 8 gates of Hirakud dam amid flood threat
303.article_body: The Odisha government has closed eight gates of Hirakud reservoir fearing a possible flood-like situation may emerge in the state. The water of the Mahanadi river is rising due to torrential rains in the catchment areas, said officials. "Water is being discharged through 26 gates instead of the 34 gates," said Special Relief Commissioner PK Jena.

304.title: Suspect brought for court hearing shot dead in UP's Hapur
304.article_body: A suspect who was brought for a hearing to the Uttar Pradesh's Hapur District Court was shot dead by unidentified assailants outside the premises on Tuesday. The undertrial had been brought from Haryana for the hearing. The suspect was arrested in Faridabad and when he was brought to court, the assailants surrounded him and fired four-five bullets.

305.title: As coal prices rise, Indian firms import petcoke from Venezuela
305.article_body: Amid surging global coal prices, Indian companies are importing large volumes of petroleum coke (petcoke) from Venezuela, according to trade sources and shipping data. Indian cement companies imported as many as four cargoes carrying 1,60,000 tonnes of petroleum coke between April and June, according to trade sources. Another cargo is expected to reach the Mangalore port soon, the data showed.

306.title: Telangana CM KCR skips Governor’s ‘At Home’ function
306.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan's traditional 'At Home' event on the occasion of Independence Day at Raj Bhavan. He had attended ‘At Home’ functions till 2020 when the relations between the CM’s office and the Raj Bhavan were cordial, reports said. Meanwhile, the CM alleged that the Centre is busy in centralising powers.

307.title: US, China may sleepwalk into conflict over Taiwan: Singapore's Dy PM
307.article_body: Singapore's Deputy PM Lawrence Wong warned that the US and China may "sleepwalk into conflict" if they don't engage with each other and de-escalate rising tensions over Taiwan. The US-China relationship is on a "very worrying" trajectory, Wong said, adding, "We're starting to see a series of decisions being taken by both countries that'll lead us into more...dangerous territory."

308.title: US' KKR sells entire 27% stake in Max Healthcare, raises ₹9,290 cr
308.article_body: US private equity firm KKR sold all of its 27% stake in Max Healthcare and raised ₹9,290 crore on Tuesday. KKR offloaded 26 crore shares at ₹355 apiece. The stake sale, through a block deal, was executed by Kalyan Investments which had invested in Max Healthcare. It sold its stake at a discount of 3.3% to the current market price.

309.title: Washington Sundar ruled out of India's tour of Zimbabwe, replaced by Shahbaz Ahmed
309.article_body: All-rounder Washington Sundar has been ruled out of India's tour of Zimbabwe after injuring his shoulder while playing in a county match in England. He has been replaced by 27-year-old all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed, who represents Bengal in domestic cricket and RCB in IPL. India will play three ODIs in Zimbabwe starting August 18.

310.title: Sri Lanka Cricket seeks ₹43.5 crore from Arjuna Ranatunga for 'loss of reputation'
310.article_body: The Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) administrators are seeking LKR 2 billion (more than ₹43.5 crore) from former World Cup-winning captain Arjuna Ranatunga for "loss of reputation". The SLC Executive Committee stated that it took the decision after "extensively deliberating" on a "false, derogatory and distorted statement" made by Ranatunga during a recent media interview.

311.title: Forever 21 owner Authentic Brands to buy Ted Baker for $254 million
311.article_body: Authentic Brands (ABG) has agreed to buy Ted Baker in a cash deal worth roughly £211 million ($254 million), the companies announced on Tuesday. The UK-based fashion chain was forced to put itself up for sale in April after it suffered COVID-19 pandemic-related losses. New York-based ABG owns brands like Forever 21, Juicy Couture and Reebok.

312.title: I am seeing it as the Asia Cup, not India vs Pakistan: Sourav Ganguly
312.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said he is looking at the Asia Cup as a tournament rather than considering it as India taking on Pakistan. "When I used to...[play], India vs Pakistan was just another match for me. I always looked to win the tournament," added Ganguly. "India...have done very well in the recent times," he stated.

313.title: Debina Bonnerjee, Gurmeet Choudhary expecting their 2nd baby; share ultrasound pics
313.article_body: Television actors Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary are expecting their second baby. Debina, who shared a picture of herself hugging Gurmeet and gave a glimpse of ultrasound images, wrote, "Few decisions are divinely timed and nothing can change that...this is one such blessing." The couple welcomed their first child, daughter Lianna, in April this year.

314.title: UP man gets alleged beheading threat after he distributes Tricolour
314.article_body: An FIR has been registered after a man alleged that posters threatening him with beheading were pasted around his house after he distributed the Tricolour in his neighbourhood in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor. A senior police official said that security has been deployed at the man's residence. "Action will be taken on the basis of facts," the senior police official added.

315.title: Film journalist Kaushik LM passes away at 35
315.article_body: Film journalist Kaushik LM has passed away at the age of 35. Kaushik went to sleep at 2 pm on Monday and reportedly suffered a cardiac arrest. "Thinking of you and saying a prayer. You will be missed," actor Vijay Deverakonda tweeted. "This is truly heartbreaking. I so so wish this isn't true," actor Dulquer Salmaan wrote.

316.title: 'Dostvaad' should also end: Sisodia on PM's 'Parivarvaad' remark
316.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said not just 'Parivarvaad' (dynasty politics), but 'Dostvaad' (favouring friends) should also be ended to cleanse the country of corruption. "Dostvaad has destroyed the country's economy," Sisodia said at a press conference on Monday. His comments came after PM Modi called upon people to extend their support in the "fight against nepotism and dynasty systems".

317.title: PM Modi extends birthday wishes to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal
317.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday greeted Delhi CM and AAP national convenor on his 54th birthday. "Birthday greetings to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal Ji. I pray for his long life and good health," PM Modi tweeted. Kejriwal replied saying, "Thank you sir." Meanwhile, other politicians including Bhagwanth Khuba, Hardeep Singh Puri and Supriya Sule also wished CM Kejriwal.

318.title: Delhi boys return from holiday, find mom, grandmother dead with stab wounds
318.article_body: A 70-year-old woman and her daughter-in-law were found dead when the former's grandsons, who were on a holiday in Uttarakhand, returned and found their bodies with stab wounds. Police said that no signs of forced entry into the house were found and that the boys found the main door partially open. Investigators suspect involvement of someone known to the women.

319.title: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel announces 3% DA hike for govt employees
319.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel, on the occasion of India's 76th Independence Day on Monday, announced a 3% hike in the dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees under the 7th Pay Commission, with retrospective effect from January 1, 2022. The hike will benefit around 9.38 lakh employees of the Gujarat government, panchayat service and pensioners, Patel added.

320.title: iSelect Guaranteed Future Plan for financial planning: Canara HSBC
320.article_body: iSelect Guaranteed Future Plan presented by Canara HSBC is a life insurance savings cum protection plan that provides you 5 options to cater to your needs with Pay or Premium Protection Cover. The plan offers tax saving benefits along with an alternate source of savings to help you achieve your financial goals, it stated.

321.title: Militant group claims it killed 4 Russian mercenaries in Mali
321.article_body: An Al-Qaeda-affiliated terrorist group on Monday claimed that it had killed four mercenaries from Russia's private military firm Wagner Group in an ambush in central Mali. The militants of Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimeen (JNIM) group reportedly clashed with the Russian mercenaries on Saturday in the Mopti region. Mali has been fighting Islamist insurgency for decades.

322.title: Heavy rain in Mumbai; MeT predicts occasional intense showers in next 24 hrs
322.article_body: Mumbai witnessed heavy rainfall on Tuesday as rain intensity increased in the city after a gap of a few days. As per Meteorological department's forecast, cloudy sky with moderate rain in Mumbai and suburbs with occasional intense spells is expected for the next 24 hours. There will be a high tide of 4.39 metres in Arabian Sea, an official said.

323.title: Indian team looks different when Hardik is in full flow: Zimbabwe batting coach
323.article_body: Zimbabwe batting coach Lance Klusener has said India looks different when all-rounder Hardik Pandya is in "full flow". He added, "Hardik adds glue to any white-ball side...It's so good to have him back and he's getting into the form we are accustomed to." Hardik is not part of India's squad for the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe.

324.title: Team India was 'not that' aggressive under Virat Kohli: Aakash Chopra
324.article_body: Former India opener Aakash Chopra said Virat Kohli was very aggressive on the field while leading Team India but his team was "not that" aggressive. "He talked about intent many times but we saw [Cheteshwar] Pujara getting run out twice in one match," added Aakash. "Rohit Sharma...doesn't look animated but the team that plays under him attacks," he stated.

325.title: Ask senior Muslim community members to take action: BJP MLA on Shivamogga incident
325.article_body: BJP MLA KS Eshwarappa reacted to the stabbing incident following communal clashes in Shivamogga, saying, "I request senior members of Muslim community to take action against youth of their community [who are] involved in such anti-national activities." Four people, identified as Nadeem, Tanveer, Charbi and Abdul Rehman, were arrested in connection with the stabbing incident, PTI reported.

326.title: Kunal Ghosh gives secret news of TMC to BJP: BJP MP Saumitra Khan
326.article_body: BJP MP Saumitra Khan has claimed that TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh gives the "secret news" of TMC to BJP. "When Ghosh was in jail even then he used to pass on inside news of TMC to people and even now after meeting [Dharmendra] Pradhan, Ghosh continues to give the secret news of TMC to BJP," Khan added.

327.title: Bus carrying 39 security personnel falls into riverbed after brake fail in J&K, 6 martyred
327.article_body: Six Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel have lost their lives, while several others received injuries after a bus carrying 37 ITBP personnel and two personnel from Jammu and Kashmir Police fell into a riverbed in Pahalgam after its brakes reportedly failed on Tuesday. Injured personnel are being airlifted to Army hospital, Srinagar for treatment, police said.

328.title: Bipasha Basu expecting 1st child with Karan Singh Grover, shares pics
328.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu on Tuesday announced that she is expecting her first child with actor-husband Karan Singh Grover. Sharing pictures, she wrote, "A new time, a new phase, a new light adds another unique shade to our prism of life." "A creation manifested by our love, our baby will join us soon and add to our glee," she added.

329.title: 20 people burnt alive in bus-oil tanker collision in Pakistan
329.article_body: At least 20 people were burnt alive in a collision between a passenger bus and an oil tanker in Pakistan's Punjab province, rescue officials said. The accident occurred on a highway in Multan, around 350 km from Lahore, allegedly because of over-speeding, the police said. "The bodies will be handed over to the families after a DNA test," officials said.

330.title: Berkshire Hathaway buys more Apple, Chevron shares, sells Verizon stock
330.article_body: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway purchased 3.9 million shares of Apple in the second quarter, increasing its stake in the firm to 5.6%. It also raised its stake in Chevron to about 8.2% by buying around 2.3 million more shares of it. Among the holdings that were disposed of by Berkshire in Q2 were Verizon and Royalty Pharma.

331.title: Want to play a man who wears uniform as my dad was in Army: Abhishek
331.article_body: Actor Abhishek Banerjee has said that he wants to play a role of a man who wears a uniform. Speaking about the reason, he said, "I've seen my dad, he was in the Army...I've seen him waking up at 4 am and doing the duties," he added. Abhishek added he's closely seen the physical and mental endurance the officers need.

332.title: It's 1st time I'll share stage with Nick: Priyanka on Global Citizen festival
332.article_body: Speaking about the Global Citizen music festival, actress Priyanka Chopra has said that it will be the first time she will share the stage with her husband Nick Jonas. "It'll be very exciting. I love the Jonas Brothers, but I'm...excited to see Mariah Carey and Rosalía," she further added. Metallica and Charlie Puth will also feature at the music festival.

333.title: Germany's Scholz voices support for Russian refugees coming to EU
333.article_body: During a summit in Oslo, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said people are fleeing Russia because they disagree with the Russian regime. The statement comes amid an ongoing debate over EU visa ban on Russian citizens. Finnish PM Sanna Marin said she didn't think it was right for Russians to go ''sightseeing'' in the EU while the Russian military kills Ukrainians.

334.title: Suspended railway policeman held in Pune in 'rice puller' metal scam
334.article_body: Pune Police arrested a suspended railway police sub-inspector in connection with the 'rice puller' metal scam. The accused allegedly cheated around 200 people in Maharashtra on the pretext of investing in a 'rice puller' metal, also called 'copper iridium', used by aerospace organisations to make space equipment. This comes after two brothers from Pune were cheated of ₹49 lakh.

335.title: Petrol, diesel demand sees a slump in August due to monsoons
335.article_body: With the onset of the monsoon, the fuel demand saw a slump in sectors such as agriculture, preliminary industry data showed. While petrol consumption remained flat in the first half of August, diesel demand witnessed an 11.2% drop compared with the first half of July. The demand for petrol and diesel is traditionally lower in July-September than in April-June.

336.title: India might have nomination in 'final 5' if RRR is picked: Kashyap on Oscars
336.article_body: Talking about the Oscars, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said, "India might...have a nomination in the final five if 'RRR' is the film...we pick." Kashyap added there are "99% chances" of 'RRR' being nominated for the Oscars if selected as India's official entry. "[The West] finds it better than any Marvel movie. They've...gone crazy even at the film's silliness," he stated.

337.title: MMRDA plans tunnel to connect Eastern Freeway to Girgaon Chowpatty: Report
337.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is reportedly exploring the possibility of constructing a tunnel to connect Eastern Freeway from P D'Mello Road to Girgaon Chowpatty to ensure smooth access to the coastal road. As per the report, MMRDA has invited bids to finalise a consultant to conduct a feasibility study and make a detailed project report.

338.title: Around 30 ministers join Bihar Cabinet, Tejashwi Yadav's brother Tej Pratap sworn-in
338.article_body: Nearly 30 leaders, including Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav's brother and RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav, were sworn in as part of Bihar's new Cabinet under Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. Ahead of the Cabinet expansion, JD(U) MLA Leshi Singh on Tuesday confirmed that she will be getting a post in the new cabinet.

339.title: Bite marks on man's face help police catch him for molesting 17-yr-old girl in Thane
339.article_body: Bite marks on a man's face helped the Thane police trace and arrest him for allegedly molesting a 17-year-old girl on a skywalk in Maharashtra's Thane. Police said that the accused allegedly caught hold of her from behind and molested her, following which she resisted his move and bit his face to free herself. She later approached the police.

340.title: Person hoists religious flag above national flag in Goa; arrested
340.article_body: A 43-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly hoisting a religious flag above the national flag at his rented accommodation in Goa's Ponda. A police inspector told IANS that the other flag "is not Pakistan's national flag, but a resemblance". A case has been filed under Section 2 of the Prevention of Insults to National Honour Act, 1971.

341.title: US Justice Dept opposes revealing evidence supporting search of Trump’s home
341.article_body: The US Justice Department opposed efforts to make public the affidavit supporting the search warrant for ex-US President Donald Trump's Florida home, saying the document contains sensitive material. Making the affidavit public would also "cause significant and irreparable damage to this ongoing criminal investigation," it added. Many news organisations have applied to have the affidavit unsealed.

342.title: A film rich in merit can take boycott, 'Laal...' didn't have merit: Taran
342.article_body: Film critic Taran Adarsh said a film rich in merit can withstand boycott and any opposition in the form of exams, IPL matches and bad weather. "'Laal Singh Chaddha'...was devoid of merit," he added. "The stars are still sleeping," stated Taran. Producer Girish Johar earlier said the box office start of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' had sent "shockwaves".

343.title: We're asking India to bring their A game: Zimbabwe batting coach Lance Klusener
343.article_body: Zimbabwe batting coach and ex-South Africa all-rounder Lance Klusener has said they want India to bring their "A game" in their upcoming three-match ODI series. "It's a series we're looking forward to...they may be too strong for us but if we play well and put them under pressure, then ODI cricket is a funny game...anything can happen," he added.

344.title: Adani Logistics acquires ICD in Gujarat's Tumb for ₹835 crore
344.article_body: Adani Logistics on Tuesday announced that it has acquired an inland container depot (ICD) in Gujarat's Tumb from Navkar Corporation for ₹835 crore. ICD Tumb has a capacity of 0.5 million TEU and is located between the Hazira port and the Nhava Sheva port. Adani Logistics is a wholly owned subsidiary of Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited.

345.title: Sidharth Malhotra & Kiara Advani to reunite after 'Shershaah': Report
345.article_body: Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani will reportedly reunite for a film after 'Shershaah'. As per a report by India Today, the film is titled 'Adal Badal' and will be produced by Sunir Kheterpal. "The movie is set to be a rom-com with a lot of VFX and CGI work involved as well," a source close to the development said.

346.title: US, S Korea, Japan hold missile defence drills for the 1st time since 2017
346.article_body: US, South Korea and Japan carried out a ballistic missile defence exercise off Hawaii's coast, the Pentagon said in a statement. It was first such exercise since 2017 which saw participation of the three countries. The Pentagon's statement said that the drills demonstrated the three countries' commitment to respond to challenges posed by North Korea and protect shared security.

347.title: H&M back on Alibaba's Tmall, 16 months after Xinjiang controversy
