347.article_body: Swedish fashion retailer H&M's official store on Alibaba's Tmall e-commerce platform reopened after the latter had taken it down 16 months earlier. H&M had cited concerns about human rights abuses in China's Xinjiang and had pledged not to source cotton from that region. According to UN experts and other rights groups, Uyghurs and other minorities have been detained in Xinjiang.

348.title: US' World Trade Centre digitally displays Tricolour to celebrate India's Independence Day
348.article_body: The World Trade Centre in New York digitally displayed the Tricolour to celebrate India's Independence Day. Earlier, US President Joe Biden extended wishes to India, saying, "The US joins the people of India to honour its democratic journey, guided by Mahatma Gandhi's enduring message of truth and non-violence." He also said that India and US are "indispensable partners".

349.title: Jhunjhunwala's 1st purchase of Titan stock was made by chance: Damani
349.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's first purchase of Titan Company stock was made by chance, investor Ramesh Damani has revealed. "There is this folklore that he bought Titan after studying it or after accessing some insider information, but...he bought it because his broker had a lot and he came to Rakesh before going to anyone else," Damani told Moneycontrol.

350.title: Investment firm Tiger Global cuts stakes in most companies amid losses
350.article_body: US-based investment firm Tiger Global Management has slashed or completely exited most of its holdings in the second quarter, according to a filing released on Monday. Tiger Global reduced positions in Microsoft, Coinbase, DoorDash, JD.com, Nu Holdings, Snowflake, CrowdStrike Holdings and Carvana. According to the filing, the firm dissolved investments in Robinhood, Zoom Video Communications.

351.title: 72 farmers arrested for not protesting at designated site in B'luru
351.article_body: About 72 farmers were arrested on Monday for not protesting at Freedom Park, which is the only designated protesting site in Bengaluru. Farmers in Devanahalli have been protesting against Karnataka Industrial Area Development Board's (KIADB) proposal to purchase 1,777 acres of fertile land. According to reports, 387 families will lose their land if KIADB goes ahead with the acquisition.

352.title: It’s nation’s demand that Nitish Kumar leads country, Oppn: JD(U) MLA
352.article_body: JD(U) MLA Leshi Singh on Tuesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will take the state to new heights. "It’s the demand of the nation that he leads the country, leads the Opposition in the country," Singh added. "Mahagathbandhan government will work well, the pace of development will increase and work will be firmly done," Singh stated.

353.title: Shiv Sena MLA slaps catering manager over quality of food for labourers; video surfaces
353.article_body: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Santosh Bangar purportedly abused and slapped a private catering manager on Monday over serving poor quality mid-day meal food to labourers in his constituency of Hingoli in Maharashtra. A video of the incident has surfaced online and has gone viral on social media. Notably, Bangar had joined Eknath Shinde's camp minutes before the Assembly floor test.

354.title: Apple lays off about 100 contract-based recruiters in a rare move: Report
354.article_body: Apple laid off about 100 contract-based recruiters across regions in the past week in a rare move for the world's most valuable company, Bloomberg reported. Terminated contractors will reportedly receive pay and medical benefits for two weeks. During the earnings call, CEO Tim Cook had said that Apple will be "deliberate" with spending decisions as it faces an economic slowdown.

355.title: Took Navy base pics, flew drone; police said 'Not allowed to do it': Aayush
355.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma recalled an incident when he got in trouble with police while he was a student. "I went somewhere in South Mumbai and took pictures of a Navy base, I had flown a drone. Suddenly they told me 'you aren't allowed to do this' and I said 'I'm so sorry'," he added.

356.title: Putin critic Navalny says he’s in solitary confinement
356.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexey Navalny on Monday said prison officials ordered him to serve at least three days in solitary confinement following his efforts to create a labour union in jail. He added that prison authorities have warned that it would become his "permanent residence" unless he reconsiders his "attitude". Navalny is currently serving an 11.5-year sentence.

357.title: Female SI catches mobile snatcher who was trying to escape in Delhi
357.article_body: A female Sub-Inspector (SI) of the Delhi Police, Kiran Sethi, caught a person who was trying to escape after snatching the phone of a man waiting at a bus stand in Kamla Market, officials said on Monday. The 30-year-old accused was previously involved in two cases of snatching, DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said. The mobile was recovered, she added.

358.title: 2 arrested for stabbing during communal clashes in Karnataka's Shivamogga
358.article_body: Police arrested two accused in connection with Karnataka's Shivamogga stabbing case during communal clashes, ADGP Law and Order Alok Kumar said. Notably, two others are absconding, he added. "We will seize the accused's properties," Kumar stated. Section 144 was imposed in parts of Shivamogga after Hindu activists protested against attempts to remove Veer Savarkar's poster on Independence Day.

359.title: I believe Virat will find form in Asia Cup: Sourav Ganguly
359.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said former India captain Virat Kohli, who has been on a break since the England tour, will find his form in the upcoming Asia Cup. "Let him practice, let him play matches. He is a big player and has scored plenty of runs. I am hopeful that he will make a comeback," stated Ganguly.

360.title: 'Kejriwal model' can make India a world leader:  Manish Sisodia
360.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that "Kejriwal model" is the only proven blueprint that can make India a world leader. Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's Independence Day speech, he said, "PM presented vision of making India a developed nation...This will be possible only when the Centre will put politics aside and work collaboratively on blueprint given by Delhi CM."

361.title: IAF rescues 2 persons trapped in flash floods in J&K's Kathua
361.article_body: The Indian Air Force rescued two persons trapped in the Ujh river following flash floods in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. Over a dozen animals were also trapped in the river but they couldn't be saved. According to reports, two IAF helicopters deployed for rescue operations have saved seven people in the district so far.

362.title: President Droupadi Murmu greets people on Parsi New Year
362.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu congratulated citizens on the occasion of Navroz - Parsi New Year. The President said, “On the auspicious occasion of Parsi New Year, I extend my warm greetings and best wishes to all my fellow citizens, especially our Parsi brothers and sisters. The Parsi community has significantly contributed to the development of our nation through their hard work."

363.title: Trump's ex-lawyer Giuliani a target in criminal probe into 2020 election
363.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's ex-lawyer Rudy Giuliani is a target in the criminal investigation into possible illegal attempts to interfere in 2020 election in Georgia. Giuliani could face criminal charges from the investigation by Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis. On Wednesday, Trump's former lawyer will testify before a special grand jury empanelled on Willis' request.

364.title: Giriraj Singh challenges Bihar CM to form his own govt
364.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and called him "amarbel". Singh said, "Nitish Babu will break the record of being CM for 20 years, but he is like an 'amarbel' that will never be able to become a tree. Bharatiya Janata Party made him the Chief Minister last year. I challenge Nitish to form his own government."

365.title: Tricolour hoisted at world’s highest battlefield
365.article_body: The Indian Army soldiers hoisted the Tricolour at the Siachen Glacier on the occasion of Independence Day and sang the National Anthem. They also posed for the cameras with the National Flag. The Fire and Fury Corps of the Indian Army shared the video on Twitter showing jawans walking with the National Flag and hoisting it.

366.title: 7,500 sq ft Tricolour displayed at Dal Lake in Srinagar on I-Day
366.article_body: In a joint effort by Ministry of Tourism and two educational institutions, a 7,500 square feet Tricolour was displayed at the bank of Srinagar's Dal Lake on Monday, as part of 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, ministry said. The flag weighed between 80-85 kg with supporting elements. The same Tricolour was displayed at Gujarat's Statue of Unity on October 31, 2021.

367.title: MSRTC plans to run electric buses from Thane & Borivali to Pune
367.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) is planning to run air-conditioned electric buses, called Shivai, from Thane and Borivali to Pune. The Shivai buses will replace MSRTC's Shivneri buses on the route. "We have placed an order for 150 air-conditioned electric buses and the first phase of the deliveries is expected in October," MSRTC MD Shekhar Channe said.

368.title: Court approves Apple's $30.5 million settlement in bag check lawsuit
368.article_body: A federal judge in California approved Apple Inc's $30.5 million settlement in a lawsuit that claimed that the company didn't pay nearly 15,000 retail workers for the time they spent in security checks after their shift. In 2020, the California Supreme Court ruled that state law mandated workers to be paid when they go through mandatory security checks.

369.title: India sees 8,813 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, lowest in 63 days
369.article_body: India has reported 8,813 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, a drop of 40.9% over the previous day and lowest since June 14. India also reported 29 deaths, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active cases in the country reached 1,11,252, while the daily positivity rate stood at 4.15%.

370.title: Ronaldo was decisive: Ballon d'Or organisers on his selection ahead of Messi
370.article_body: With Cristiano Ronaldo nominated for Ballon d'Or 2022 and Lionel Messi not making it to the shortlist for the first time since 2005, Ballon d'Or organisers France Football said, "Ronaldo was extremely decisive." "He became the top scorer in national football this season (117 goals)," they added. "The new criteria for...Ballon d'Or were unfavourable to Messi," stated France Football.

371.title: No corruption reported at central level under PM Modi: Maha Governor
371.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Monday said there hasn't been any corruption at the central level in last eight years of PM Modi's government. "In some places (states), officials give in writing that leaders are demanding bribes...how unfortunate it is for the country," Koshyari said. He was addressing a gathering in Pune to mark 75 years of Zilla Parishad.

372.title: Giving it the Zidane, jokes Rio Ferdinand on Darwin Nunez's headbutt
372.article_body: Reacting to Liverpool's Darwin Nunez being sent off in a Premier League match against Crystal Palace following a headbutt, ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand jokingly tweeted, "Giving it the [Zinedine] Zidane." Liverpool were held to a 1-1 draw. France's Zidane was sent off in the 2006 FIFA World Cup final for headbutting former Italy defender Marco Materazzi.

373.title: Rohit Sharma posts pic with National Flag; Twitter users claim its 'photoshopped'
373.article_body: Rohit Sharma posted a picture of himself holding the National Flag on Independence Day and tweeted, "75 years of independence." Reacting to his picture, several Twitter users pointed out that the image is photoshopped. One of the users zoomed in on the picture and wrote, "I thought just the flag was edited, but rod too."

374.title: Apple threatening to fire me for posting TikTok video on security tips: Employee
374.article_body: A New York-based Apple employee has alleged that the company is threatening to fire her for posting a viral TikTok video on iPhone security tips. Paris Campbell had posted a video asking a woman not to remove her lost iPhone from Apple ID in response to blackmailers. Campbell was told she breached company policy by identifying herself as Apple employee.

375.title: Former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee's foster daughter pays tribute on his death anniversary
375.article_body: Former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee's foster daughter Namita Kaul Bhattacharya paid floral tribute at 'Sadaiv Atal' in Delhi on his death anniversary on Tuesday. The former PM had adopted Namita, who is the daughter of Rajkumari Kaul, Vajpayee's classmate in college and his companion. President Droupadi Murmu and PM Narendra Modi also paid their tributes to former PM Vajpayee.

376.title: CPI(M) leader hacked to death in Kerala, party blames BJP, RSS
376.article_body: A 40-year-old CPI(M) leader, K Shajahan, was hacked to death in Kerala's Palakkad district by a six-member gang on Sunday, police said. He was attacked in the Kottekad region with sharp-edged weapons, added police. He was declared brought dead at a hospital. The party blamed the BJP and the RSS for the murder but both refuted the allegation.

377.title: Former BCCI Secretary Amitabh Choudhary passes away due to heart attack
377.article_body: Former BCCI Acting Secretary Amitabh Choudhary passed away on Tuesday morning after suffering a heart attack. Choudhary had served as Jharkhand State Cricket Association (JSCA) President from 2002 to 2017. He was also a former IPS officer, having served as Additional DGP of Jharkhand. Choudhary also held the post of Chairman of Jharkhand Public Service Commission (JPSC) for 20 months.

378.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states; list released
378.article_body: The IMD has predicted isolated very heavy rainfall in Rajasthan, west Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat on Tuesday. Heavy rainfall is likely over Odisha and West Bengal on August 18 and 19 and over Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh and east Madhya Pradesh on August 19. Meanwhile, heavy falls are likely over Himachal Pradesh on August 18 and Uttarakhand on August 18 and 19.

379.title: Donald Trump's passports returned after he says FBI 'stole' them during raid
379.article_body: Passports belonging to Donald Trump have been returned to the former US President after last week's FBI search of his Mar-a-Lago home, a Justice Department official told NBC News. Trump had said agents "stole my three passports, along with everything else". "This is an assault on a political opponent at a level never seen before in our country," he added.

380.title: Entire Cabinet reflects Bihar's interest, you will see that: RJD MP
380.article_body: Ahead of Bihar Cabinet expansion, RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha said that it is not just people who will join the Cabinet, every worker and MLA of RJD is a part of it. "They may not join under their names but there will be everyone's participation," Jha added. "The entire Cabinet reflects Bihar's interest, you will see that," Jha stated.

381.title: Ex-BJP MLA Amrita Meghwal threatened at gunpoint in Rajasthan
381.article_body: Former BJP MLA Amrita Meghwal was allegedly threatened at gunpoint by four to five unidentified people after they stopped her vehicle while she was travelling from Ajmer to Jalore in Rajasthan, police said. An FIR has been filed in the matter. The accused also smashed the windscreen of the vehicle, a Station House Officer (SHO) said.

382.title: First is Alia Bhatt: Naga Chaitanya on actresses he wishes to work with
382.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, during an interview, was asked about the actresses he wishes to work with in future. To this, the actor said, "There are many...First is Alia Bhatt. I love her performances." He further named Priyanka Chopra and Kareena Kapoor Khan and said he looked up to their work. "Katrina Kaif, I found her really beautiful," he concluded.

383.title: Not a diktat: Maha Min on rule to say 'Vande Mataram' on receiving calls
383.article_body: Maharashtra's newly appointed Cultural Affairs Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar said that the use of "Vande Mataram" instead of "hello" by government employees while receiving phone calls was not a diktat but it was just a suggestion. His clarification came after he received criticism from NCP leaders Ajit Pawar and Chhagan Bhujbal and Raza Academy chief Muhammad Saeed Noori.

384.title: Wild elephants attack people in Assam; 3 including child killed
384.article_body: Three persons, including a child, were killed after wild elephants attacked people in a village in Assam's Goalpara on Monday. A herd of wild elephants had come to the area in search of food from the nearby hill area of Meghalaya, according to a forest official. The incident took place along Assam-Meghalaya's bordering area, a Forest Range Officer said.

385.title: China sanctions 7 Taiwanese officials for supporting independence
385.article_body: China has sanctioned seven Taiwanese officials for supporting Taiwan's independence, Chinese state news agency Xinhua said. Among those sanctioned are Hsiao Bi-khim, Taiwan's envoy to US, and chief of Taiwan's National Security Council, Wellington Koo. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan, a move China said had sent a wrong signal to pro-independence forces on the island.

386.title: Hyderabad Police officer among 5 killed in road accident in K'taka
386.article_body: Five persons died and four others were injured in a road accident that took place in Karnataka's Bidar district on Monday. The deceased included G Giridhar, who worked as head constable with Hyderabad Police, his family and their driver. According to police, the accident took place as the car they were travelling in collided with the truck near a check-post.

387.title: How does the Premier League table read after Gameweek 2?
387.article_body: Two-time defending champions Manchester City are on top of the Premier League points table with six points from two games in the season so far. Arsenal, also with two wins, are placed second due to goal difference and are followed by Brentford. Manchester United are at the bottom for the first time in 30 years after the second weekend.

388.title: Maximum output through limited resources: Next CJI on agenda for term
388.article_body: Justice Uday Umesh Lalit, who will succeed CJI NV Ramana as the next Chief Justice of India, said the agenda for his term would be "maximum output through the limited resources". "It can be achieved by clubbing cases...listing matters that can be representative in other cases which are capable of disposing of many pending matters in lower authorities," he added.

389.title: Brazil's Lula holds 12% lead over incumbent Bolsonaro: Opinion poll
389.article_body: Former Brazilian President Lula da Silva has a lead over incumbent Jair Bolsonaro by 12-percentage-point, a new IPEC opinion poll showed. Lula, the leftist leader, has 44% voter support while Bolsonaro, the far-right leader, has 32% voter support in the first round of election, the survey said. Lula is expected to win run-off on October 30 by a 16-point lead.

390.title: Video of Johnny Depp's lookalike at religious ceremony in Iran goes viral
390.article_body: A video of a man attending a religious ceremony in Iran has gone viral on social media for his resemblance to Hollywood actor Johnny Depp. The video first appeared on TikTok and was later shared on other platforms such as Reddit. According to local media, the man's name is Amin Sa'les and he is a model.

391.title: People said 'It's a video of Punjabi wedding': Mohnish on 'Hum Aapke...'
391.article_body: Mohnish Bahl recalled the initial reactions to the 1994 film 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!' and revealed, "Some said that 'Yeh toh Punjabi shaadi ka video hai (It's a video of a Punjabi wedding)'." However, Mohnish stated that director Sooraj Barjatya made 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!' with his conviction. The film featured Salman Khan and Madhuri Dixit.

392.title: No country’s judges have workload like that handled by judges in India: Rijiju
392.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said it's easy to make sweeping comments on what the judiciary must do but reality is that India with its teeming population faces "unique challenges" which are "not easy to handle". "Each judge (in India) disposes of 40-50 cases in a day...judges of no other country have this kind of workload to handle," Rijiju added.

393.title: Walmart reaches video-streaming deal to offer Paramount+ to members
393.article_body: Walmart has struck a deal with Paramount Global to offer Paramount+ streaming service to the subscribers of its membership program. Walmart+ members will get access to Paramount's "essential" plan, which costs $4.99 per month and includes commercials. Members can also avail of the $9.99-a-month service without commercials. With this Walmart seeks to challenge Amazon's Prime membership programme.

394.title: Chinese 'spy ship' arrives at Sri Lanka port amid protest by India
394.article_body: A Chinese ship with abilities to track satellites and intercontinental missiles arrived at Hambantota port in Sri Lanka this morning. The ship, Yuan Wang 5, was allowed to dock on the condition that it will not carry out any research while in Sri Lankan waters. Sri Lanka had earlier asked China to defer the ship's planned visit after India's protest.

395.title: 4 including retired policeman, wife die as truck rams into house in UP
395.article_body: At least four persons, including a retired sub-inspector and his wife, died and five others were injured on Monday after a truck rammed into a house in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri, police said. "Two people in the truck also died...One still stuck in debris," Mainpuri SP added last night. The accident took place after the driver lost control of the truck.

396.title: Nothing to do with talent: Apurva on being picked for Pardes over Salman
396.article_body: Recalling his role in filmmaker Subhash Ghai's Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Pardes', which Salman Khan was interested in portraying, actor Apurva Agnihotri said, "It has nothing to do with my talent." "I've to thank Shatrughan Sinha's wife Punam...She got in touch with Mr Ghai," added Apurva. Ghai earlier said he refused to cast Salman as he needed someone who was stylish.

397.title: Karan offered me Bollywood film after Arjun Reddy, I was not ready then: Vijay
397.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said that filmmaker Karan Johar offered him a Bollywood movie after watching 'Arjun Reddy'. "Then I was not ready, and now, we approached with Liger as it has the pan-India appeal. He supported us well in every aspect," he added. Vijay also spoke about his character in his upcoming movie 'Liger'.

398.title: No one else 'will be stupid enough' to play Test cricket past 40: Anderson
398.article_body: England's 40-year-old pacer James Anderson has said no one else will be "stupid enough" to play Test cricket past 40 in the future. "Everything that has gone in the world with franchise cricket...short forms of the game. I can't see anyone wanting to play Test cricket for this long," he added. Anderson is currently preparing to play his 173rd Test.

399.title: Sensex rises to 59,761 points, Nifty hits 17,775 in opening trade
399.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Tuesday with Sensex and Nifty jumping 298.61 and 76.60 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 59,761.39 points and Nifty at 17,774.80. Mahindra & Mahindra, Hero MotoCorp, Asian Paints, Eicher Motors and Britannia Industries were among the major Nifty gainers, while Grasim Industries, Hindalco Industries, Apollo Hospitals, Tata Steel and ONGC slipped.

400.title: WeWork Founder raises funds for new startup, reportedly at $1 billion valuation
400.article_body: WeWork Founder Adam Neumann has raised funds from Andreessen Horowitz for Flow, his new residential real estate company focused on rentals. According to The New York Times, Flow has raised $350 million from Andreessen Horowitz, marking the venture capital firm's largest individual check ever. Flow, which is yet to start operations, is reportedly valued at $1 billion after the fundraise.
